texts.en: This is 27-year-old Rhafinos from Harare, meaning "he who does not sleep," the capital of Zimbabwe. He is single with no children. Rhafinos runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for three years. He says that his main challenge is stiff competition from big shops within the area. Rhafinos has requested a loan of $350 to buy more groceries for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to improve his standard of living. In the future, Rhafinos plans to open a big grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 43 years old and she lives in Kapan city. Karine has a specialty of nurse but she has never worked. She got married very young, at just 18 years old. Her life turned out to be very difficult and full of problems during her married years. When her elder son was 5 years old, and the younger one 3 years old, she divorced her husband. Since then, she was alone with her children with great responsibility to bring up honest people as well as feed and dress them properly. So, she began working at different places and now she works as an inspector at a reserve. Her sons are already grown-up men and both of them have higher education degrees and already work.

Karine asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams since her younger son is going to get married. She needs this money to organize his wedding party.

loans.use: to organize her younger son's wedding party

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is a young farmer from the Griboyedov village in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents, sister, wife, and one-year-old daughter. Suren works in the village local self-governance body. However, his salary is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. 

To be able to meet the daily needs of the family, Suren is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and piglets. He also cultivates alfalfa and grapes. Farming is a very important source of income for them. To be able to meet the increasing needs of his family, Suren needs to expand his agribusiness. 

A loan of $3,000 will be a great support to this hard-working, young farmer, and will enable him to purchase two steers for the livestock, to buy some forage for them, and to make previous credit repayments. Suren and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for their help in collecting the amount needed for the loan and sustaining their lives.

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 49 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She lives with her husband, who is a local businessman. They have four children between 12 and 26 years old. Only two of her children live at home with them and are attending school. 

For 10 years, Musu has been cooking and selling delicious Liberian food. Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy her ingredients wholesale and has to buy retail which is much more expensive. She likes to talk with her customers and learned how to cook from her auntie a long time ago. 

Musu has requested a loan to buy fish, meat, onions, vita, peppers, oil, rice, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to have her own place in the market and build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, onions, vita, peppers, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en:
Anitha is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the West Point area. She and her partner are living together and have a one-year-old child. 

Anitha runs a table where she sells pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc. in her area. Sales are not always good because she has few goods on her table. Anitha is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc., for her business.

She hopes to build a house for her child in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, salt, vita juice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for the shop to sell.  It will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children in better schools. 

Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more items for his shop to sell,

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat is from the Pshatavan village of the Armavir region. He lives with his mother and wife. 

Azat is a contractual serviceman in the army. He and his family are engaged in breeding piglets and in cultivating wheat, apricots, and grapes. Azat's mother and wife help him greatly in his every-day activities related to farming. 

He currently needs to enlarge his livestock to be able to address the growing costs of his family more effectively. A loan of US$ 3,000 will be a huge support to Azat and his family.  It will enable him to purchase seven steers and some forage for them. 

The family highly appreciate the lenders' support and will be very thankful to them for helping them in collecting the needed amount of loan to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seven steers and some forage for them

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a 39-year-old married man living in the coastal town of Kobuleti with his wife and two school age children. The only source of income for the family is a small-sized social assistance from the local government as they live below the poverty line. 

Vazha is jobless but owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system.  A loan of $600 will help Vazha to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol (gasoline) to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow Vazha to offer cheap service to his customers and attract them. 

His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. With this Startup loan, Vazha will start a taxi business and generate income for food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to change his car's fuel system and start a taxi business

loans.name: Alba Estela

texts.es:
Alba de 38 años, vive junto a sus hijos: una hembra y un varón de 16 años de edad (gemelos) que estudian 9° grado y un varón de 10 años que estudia 4° grado, viven en casa propia que les heredó su esposo y padre respectivamente.

 Ella Vende pupusas los días sábados y domingos en el garaje de su casa, esto lo hace desde hace 10 años, e inicio haciéndolo como una iniciativa de apoyo económico para su esposo; también, venden bebidas gaseosas, refrescos naturales y productos congelados como charamuscas, hielo y choco bananos.

 Estos Productos aprendió a elaborarlos cuando tenía 20 años y que trabajo como empleada.


El préstamo será invertido, en la compra de una cocina para la elaboración de pupusas, mesas, sillas y adecuación de un local que desea rentar en la zona comercial de la ciudad.


Con el  fallecimiento del esposo los ingresos de la familia han disminuido, solo reciben $86.00 mensual de  pensión, y necesitan generar mejores ingresos; debido a que los gastos de vida se mantienen y podrían ir en aumento conforme el avance en el estudio sus hijos.


Al mejorar las condiciones de sus equipos de trabajos, se espera que tengan mejores oportunidades de ventas y esto signifique mayores utilidades comerciales, esperando que sus condiciones de vida mejoren.

Ella dese, establecer  su  negocio en la zona comercial de la ciudad, esforzándose,  para apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio académico.
texts.en:
Alba is 38 years old. She lives with her children: 16 year old twins, one male, one female who study in Grade 9 and a 10 year old son who is in 4th grade. They live in their own house that they inherited, her from her husband, the children from their father. 

Alba has been selling pupusas from the garage of her house on Saturday and Sunday for ten years now. She started it as a way to help her husband financially. She also sells soft drinks, natural drinks, and frozen products like charamuscas (like a frozen smoothie), snow cones and chocolate bananas. She learned how to make these products as an employee when she was 20 years old.

Alba will invest the loan to buy a kitchen to make pupusas, tables, chairs and to adapt the space she wants to rent in the city center. With the passing of her husband, the family's income has fallen. They get $86 monthly as a pension and they need to generate more money given that their expenses are the same as before and might increase as the children advance in school.

Improving the condition of her work environment, she hopes to enjoy greater opportunities for sales and this would bring greater business profits. She hopes to improve their standard of living. She wants to establish her business in the city center, trying very hard to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen to make pupusas, tables, chairs and adapting the place she wants to rent in the center of the city.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 21-year-old, married female. She has one child who is 3 years old and whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. 

She has a cafe. She has been in this business, which is located at Kijiwetanga, for five years. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. She is taking her first loan of 10,000  KES which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. Mwanaisha will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make food for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es una humilde señora originaria de la ciudad de Esteli. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por brindarle la oportunidad  de adquirir créditos ya que a través de este logro surtir su negocio y abastecer a todos sus clientes, así también a mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia. El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar productos lácteos. Solicita este nuevo préstamo para comprar: Crema, yogurt, leche, mantequilla, entre  otros con el fin de aumentar su inventario y satisfacer las necesidades de sus  clientes.  Su plan próximo es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Cristina is a modest woman, a native of the city of Esteli. She is a businessperson and runs a small store. She is pleased with Kiva and MiCredito for giving her the opportunity to get loans. Because of the loans she has been able to stock her business and supply her clients with goods and also improve the quality of living of her family.

Cristina used the previous credit to buy dairy products. She's requested this loan to buy cream, yogurt, milk and butter etc. with the goal of increasing her inventory and satisfying her customers. Her next plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy cream, yogurt, milk, butter, etc.

loans.name: Jafete

texts.pt:
Jafete  de 30 anos de idade é balconista , tem 1 filho com 4 anos de idade é casado vive na casa própria sustenta  2 irmaos que vivem com ele.
Com o valor ira comprar porta, areia, ferro, cimento, pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Planos para o futuro ter um restaurante proprio, adiquirir um espaco no campo onde passa servir  de quinta para criar gado e fazer machamba.
Diz que  compromete se a pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar  seus projectos
texts.en:
Jafete is 30 years old. He's a store clerk and has a 4-year-old son. He's married and lives in a house that he owns. He supports two siblings who live with him.
With this amount he'll purchase a door, sand, iron, cement and rocks so he can continue his construction work.
His plans for the future are to own a restaurant and acquire a plot of land that he can use for raising cattle and farming.
He states that he pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans so he can achieve his projects.

loans.use: to purchase a door, sand, iron, cement and rocks.

loans.name: Gifurwe Group

texts.fr:
Ferdinand  fait partie du groupe  Gifurwe  et  habite à Bubanza. Il   a 32 ans et est marié à Pascasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 2 à 9 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis 18 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  2 futs d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années , il  voudrait  construire une  belle  maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ferdinand  is part of the group called Gifurwe  and lives in Bubanza. He is 32 and is married to Pascasie, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 2 to 9 years of age, four of whom are school-going. He has been selling palm oil for 18 years. 

This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he will obtain, he is going to grow his working capital and buy two jerrycans of palm oil to resell so as to earn more income. 

In the years to come, he would like to build a nice house and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy two jerrycans of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Aaron Scott

texts.es:
Aaron es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos,el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Aaron se encuentra estudiando una carrera tecnica.
Por iniciativa propia,Aaron trabaja como cocinero en un restaurante de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Aaron se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara un horno, el cual utilizara para preparar pasteles y postres para su venta, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Aaron is a single, young, 19-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica, which is in the district of Parcona, with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and hopes to improve himself. 

Thanks to the effort and support of his parents, Aaron is in technical school. Aaron also works as a cook at a restaurant in his city.  He works about 8 hours every day and thinks that it is going well due to his dedication and effort.

Aaron is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he has been able to purchase an oven which he uses to make cakes and desserts to sell. This allows him to continue working and making an effort to achieve his ultimate goal of owning his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
Tiburcio es productor de leche, la cual vende a una de las empresas recogedoras de leche. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales están en edad escolar, en la comunidad Merke Achacachi del municipio de Achacachi, a dos horas y  media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con cuatro cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche de  buena calidad cuya venta es su procipal fuente de ingresos.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y así incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Tiburcio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando mucho más  su producción.
Es la  segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Tiburcio is a milk producer.  He sells the milk to one of the milk harvesting companies.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their four school-age children.  They live in the Merke Achacachi community in the Achacachi municipality, which is a two and a half hour trip from the city of La Paz.  He has four head of livestock, which give him good quality milk.  The milk sales are his main source of income.

He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow.  This way he will increase his milk production and his income for his family.  Tiburcio’s dream is to increase his head of cattle, which will greatly increase his production.

It is the second time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Estrela

texts.pt:
Estrela tem 39 anos de idade é comerciante, viúva há 3 anos tem 4 filhos dos quais 3 estudam e 1 ainda menor e vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do crédito quer comprar capulanas, lenços, roupas de bebé para reforçar o seu negócio.
Para o futuro tem como planos fazer uma barraca na sua casa , fazer dependencias para arrendar como forma de reforcar a renda familiar e vedar seu quintal com muro.
Diz que compromete se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos para realizar os seus planos a longo prazo e sustentar os estudos dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Estrela is 39 years old and a vendor. She has been a widow for three years and has four children, three of whom study and one is still underage. She lives in a house that she owns.
With the amount of the loan she wishes to purchase traditional skirts, scarves and baby clothes so she can boost her business.
Her plans for the future are to set up a sales booth in her house, build rooms for renting out as a way of increasing her family's income, and put up a wall around her yard.
She states that she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans again. That way she'll accomplish her long-term plans and afford her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts, scarves and baby clothes.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en: Radik is an agronomist from the village of Gay, of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, as well as his school-aged daughter and son (17 and 16 years old), his mother, and his sister. Radik and his family members are engaged in cultivation of beans, cabbage, eggplant, peppers, greens, and alfalfa. They cultivate plants in the greenhouse. Radik sells the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is the only source of income for the family. To sustain his agribusiness Radik currently needs to make some investments. He needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase some necessary materials for building a greenhouse (pipes, cellophane), to buy some fertilizers, to purchase seeds of cucumber, pepper and greens, and to renovate the greenhouse. Radik and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders. He will be very thankful to the lenders for helping his family collect the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop the agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary materials for building a greenhouse (pipes, cellophane), to buy some fertilizers, to purchase cucumber, pepper and greens seeds, and to renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 25 years old and lives in the area of West Point. She’s married and stopped her education in junior high. She has a 3-year-old child who attends school and lives at home.

Yassah has been selling oil, vita, onions, etc. for the past 15 years. Her biggest challenge is low commodities.

Yassah is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, vita, onions, etc. for her business. She hopes and prays for God to bestow divine favor upon the life of her child, so that her child's dreams will come to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, vita, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is an experienced farmer from Aghavnatun village in the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and one-year-old son. To be able to meet the needs of his family, Roland is engaged in breeding cows and pigs, and in beekeeping. He also cultivates greens, strawberries, and grapes. Roland's family members help him greatly in his everyday farming activities. His son realizes the agricultural products in the local market. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Roland needs to find ways to meet the needs of his family more effectively. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support for Roland and his family and will enable him to purchase fertilizers, to buy some forage for the livestock, to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse, and to make previous credit repayments. Roland and his family members will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, forage for the livestock, and cellophane for the greenhouse, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir is a private entrepreneur from Armavir city in the Armavir region. He lives with his parents, his wife, and his 10-year-old daughter. To be able to take care of his family's needs, Vladimir is running a local small store, where he sells towels, curtains and bedding. Vladimir’s wife and mother help him run the business. The assortment of goods he sells in his store is not that big and it needs to be expanded in order for his small business to function in a more sustainable way. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great help by enabling him to purchase towels, linens, and bedding to resell in the store. Vladimir and his family will be grateful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan for sustaining their small business.

loans.use: to purchase towels, linens, and bedding to resell

loans.name: Inês

texts.pt:
Inês  e comerciante, tem 49 anos de idade é mãe solteira de um menino de 14 anos que estuda. Ela vive na casa própria num espaço cedido pela mãe e sustent 1 sobrinha.
Com este valor vai comprar fatos, juvetes, lençois e mantas para revender por encomendas e faz recolhas no final do mês.
No futuro tem planos de crescer no negocio e satisfazer as necessidades dos seus cliente.
Diz que irá comprar uma viatura para facilitar o seu negócio e que irá pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Inês is a vendor. She's 49 years old and the single mother of a 14-year-old son who's in school. She lives in a house that she owns which is located on a space provided by her mother. She supports a niece.
With this amount she'll purchase suits, garments, sheets and blankets for re-selling. She sells by order and collects payments at the end of the month.
Her plans for the future are to make progress in her business and meet her customers' needs.
She states that she'll purchase a vehicle to make her business easier. She also states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans again.

loans.use: to purchase suits, garments, sheets and blankets.

loans.name: Mark Jonathan

texts.en:
Business Description: Solar Solutions PNG Ltd aims to bring a range of high-quality and affordable Barefoot Power solar lighting products to address a critical need for lighting and other basic energy uses in Papua New Guinea (PNG). 

Solar Solutions will accomplish this by setting up a value chain that adds revenue to local small businesses and creates new jobs, bringing clean energy far into rural areas as well as in major cities.  

Company Background: Solar Solutions is a start-up company dedicated to improving energy access in PNG. The founders collectively have several decades of experience working in FMCG goods there. In launching a new company, they decided to sell small solar products due to the poor energy situation in Papua New Guinea. 

Only 10% of PNG has energy access, which means that most people in rural areas rely on dangerous, polluting energy sources to light up their homes at night. Too often we read in the news about children injured by fire from a candle or a kerosene lamp. By reducing indoor air pollution, solar lighting improves health as well as safety. 

Energy access in cities is also poor. Often there are long hours of the day when the power is out. People in cities need back-up lighting and power to continue basic tasks after sunset. 

Our plan is to set up a reliable distribution network throughout the country by tapping into well-established local businesses in each province who can share the benefits of Solar in their provinces and communities.

A Kiva loan will enable us to scale up quickly so that we can reach more households with clean energy.

Partnering with Barefoot will allow us to utilize the expertise that Barefoot Power has gained since its inception and put those learnings into practice. This will help us build a sustainable business supplying a much needed product, in a country that has less than 10% of its population connected to power and who are currently unable to benefit from having an affordable sustainable power source that will assist them in so many ways to develop.

I have devoted 26 years of my working life to PNG and want to help this country develop so that my children and extended family, as well as the millions of other Papua New Guineans can look forward to a brighter future full of promise.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mark Jonathan from Papua New Guinea

loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Augustina's Group

texts.en:
Augustina's group is located on the outskirts of Teshie Township. The group members are basically involved in the small-scale retail sale of vegetables (okra, tomatoes, onions), corn dough, beans and palm oil. They have an average age of 29 years and on average two children. 

Augustina is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of two. Her main business is to supply vegetables especially okra to vegetable sellers in Accra. She buys the items from the eastern part of the country where she comes from and supplies them to customers in Accra where she lives. Both her children are going to school. 

Augustina is sometimes supported by her husband who is a civil servant. Her main clients are basically vegetable traders in Accra. Augustina is determined to use the loan of GHS 600 from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to change her life and that of her family by investing it in her vegetable business. She is on her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana and has repaid all previous loans without trouble. 

The group needs a total amount of GHS 1,500 so that they can increase their stock and serve their customers better.

loans.use: To supply vegetables especially okra to vegetable sellers in Accra.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Carlos trabalha como empacotador numa empresa do ramo agrícola. Ele tem 25 anos de idade, é  pai de 1 filho com 3 anos é casado, vive na casa do seu irmão mais velho.
Com o valor do emprestimo quer legalizar um espaco e comprar cimento, areia e blocos para iniciar a sua obra.
Diz que seu plano é iniciar a construção de sua casa e passar a viver lá, voltar a estudar, e oficializar sua relação casando.
Compromete se a honrar com o plano de repagamentos e diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Carlos works as a packer for an agricultural company. He's 25 years old and has a 3-year-old son. He's married and lives in his older brother's house.
With the amount of the loan he wishes to buy the title to a plot of land and purchase cement, sand and bricks so he can begin his construction work.
He states that his plan is to start building his house and then move there, go back to school and make his marriage official.
He pledges to abide by the repayment schedule and states that he'll request more loans again.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en: Mishi is a 22-year-old, married female. She has two children, one-and-a-half years old, who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she has a cafe. She has been in this business for three years. Her cafe is located at Msoloni in Malindi. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 7,000 KES. She is taking her first loan of 10,000 KES. She intends to use her loan to add stock to her business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil . Mishi will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock, including wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil to make food for her customers.

loans.name: Leontina

texts.en:
Leontina is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a business selling local gin and has been in this business for three years. She sells to all categories of people excluding children, wholesale only, seven days out of every week.  She generates additional income from working as a sweeper with Kampala Capital City Authority.  

Leontina   works from home and has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is   aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub selling local gin and also aspires to buy a plot of land and start farming. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly  expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has children. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a general store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is a farmer from Dalarik village in the Armavir region. His family consists of his wife and son. The latter has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant to be able to work there and help his family from abroad. Ashot works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the family's needs. He is engaged in breeding cows, pigs, and hens, and in the cultivation of apricots. Ashot realizes the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. As autumn is progressing, Ashot needs to purchase forage for the livestock. He needs a loan of USD 600 to buy forage for the livestock. Ashot and his family rely on the good will and support of the lenders and will be very thankful to them.

loans.use: to buy forage for the livestock

loans.name: José Omar

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, esta casado desde hace 18 años; ella trabaja en un hotel  de la ciudad, tienen un hijo de 18 años de edad, que es bachiller y trabaja en otro hotel, una hija de 11 años que estudia  cuarto grado. Viven en casa de un cuñado. 

José se dedica a la sastrería, desde que tenía 16 años de edad, le enseño el oficio  un amigo del papá. Sus clientes llegan a su casa para que él tome las medidas, la mayoría de ellos llevan las telas; pero, él posee en inventario, algunas telas finas para mostrárselas a sus clientes exclusivos.

El préstamo será invertido, en la compra de materiales de construcción, para terminar con la construcción de una cochera y con los acabados de la misma.


Con el financiamiento terminará la obra que de momento posee inconclusa. Es importante mencionar, que en la cochera de la casa él hace su trabajo.

Manifiesta que seguirá, trabajando duro, para darle el estudio a su hija y apoyar al hijo para que concluya una profesión en la universidad.
texts.en:
Jose, who is 43 years old, has been married for 18 years. His wife works in a hotel in the city. They have an 18-year-old son who is a high school graduate and works in a different hotel, and an 11-year-old daughter who is in fourth grade. They live in a relative's home. 

Jose has worked as a tailor since he was 16 years old. He learned the trade from a friend of his father. His customers arrive at his home so that he can take their measurements. The majority of them bring the fabric, but he also has some inventory which includes fine fabrics that he offers to his exclusive clients. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials so that he can finish building a garage and putting the finishing touches on it. With this financing, he will complete this project, which is currently unfinished. It is important to mention that he does his work in the garage. He states that he will continue to work hard so that his daughter can stay in school and so that he can support his son and allow him to finish his university degree.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish building a garage and putting the finishing touches on it.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio y su esposa son productores de leche; vive en casa propia tienen cinco hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos trabaja en la ciudad de  La Paz, actualmente vive con sus cuatro hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, en la comunidad Merke Achacachi del municipio de Achacachi, a dos   horas y  media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, producto que vende para obtener ingresos.

El crédito lo requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de julio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción  de leche en su comunidad.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio and his wife are dairy farmers. They live in their own home and have five children, one of whom works in the city of La Paz. Four of his children currently live with him, since they are still in school. They live in the Merke Achacachi community in the Achacachi municipality, which is two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. 

He has a few heads of cattle that provide him with milk, which he sells to earn money. He needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow and increase milk production and increase profits for his family. 

Julio's dream is to increase the number of cattle that he owns, increasing milk production in his community. This is the second loan that he has requested through IMPRO and his first time working with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and increase profits.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses grew up in Kitui, two hours south of Nairobi, Kenya, but moved to the capitol city after school. Upon arrival, Moses settled in the Mukuru informal settlement and quickly learned that youth unemployment and poor sanitation were dominant issues in the slum. He therefore developed interest in being a part of the solution to these two issues, which were affecting him directly. This is when he learned about the Fresh Life toilets, which he sees as a solution to both unemployment and unhygienic sanitation.

Moses therefore seeks funding to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet. He believes that investment in a Fresh Life toilet is a step in the right direction towards solving the sanitation issue in the slum. He hopes to buy more Fresh Life toilets in future and create employment opportunities for the youth.

loans.use: to purchase and run a Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Trinidad's Group

texts.en:
Trinidad and Aristeo live in the state of Veracruz, in the beautiful community of Chontla.  

Trinidad is 24 years old and lives in a single-room house along with his beloved wife and their three year old.   All his life, Trinidad worked in farming as a way of living, his father taught him and his brothers everything there is to know about reaping and harvesting.  His job as a peasant allows him to earn a monthly income of $270 USD, but his earnings may vary because they depend on the rain season.  Trinidad is a hardworking man, and when his little boy came into his life he set a goal: work as hard as he can to improve his child´s quality of life. 

Trinidad´s community lacks public services, and in order to light his house during nighttime he uses a diesel lamp.  He refills the lamp weekly in the nearest town, one hour away from Chontla.  Trinidad thinks that diesel lamps are expensive and hazardous, and that’s why he wishes to purchase a solar home system.  He believes it will improve his household's quality of life and even allow him and his wife extend their productive hours during nighttime, so they can increase their earnings and offer a better future to their children.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will let him work at night.

loans.name: Pedro's Group

texts.en:
Pedro and Pedro live in the community of "El Arca" in the state of Campeche.  They have been neighbors for many years they share many family activities.  Their respective two sons and one daughter go to the same school and have become very close friends as well. 

Pedro works in one of the oil rigs owned by the state.  He works 15 days in open waters to extract oil and then comes home for another 15 days.  During the time he spends at home, he tries to dedicate his time to his sons and daughter and works with them in their homework and other activities. 

Before the option of a solar home system came, Pedro´s family used car batteries to light their home.  Pedro believes that the use of a car battery was hard on his children's health and that it affected the time they spent together as a family.  By purchasing a solar home system, the children are able to do their homework or other house activities even after the sun has set.  Now Pedro can make the most of his 15 days at home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home lighting system to replace the use of car batteries

loans.name: Julianah

texts.en: Julianah is 32 years old. She is a female, married, and supports two children, ages 8 and 4, respectively. Julianah was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and she is a taking her first loan from KADET of 15,000 KES. She runs a scrap metal and plastic business which has been located, for three years now, at Maweni in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She will use the loan to add stock, scrap metals and scrap plastics, in her business . Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future are to expand her business. She also plans to educate her children and make sure her children live well.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals and plastics for her business.

loans.name: Voski

texts.en: Voski is an agronomist from the city of Armavir of the Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband and son. Voski's husband is currently residing in Russia and gets pension there, a part of which he sends to his family to be able to live on. Voski is engaged in cattle breeding. Her son helps her in her everyday activities related to cattle breeding. To sustain her agribusiness, Voski currently needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase two steers, some forage for the cattle, and to make previous credit repayments. The loan will be a huge support to this hard-working woman, and will help her to maintain and develop her agribusiness. Voski and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, some forage for the cattle, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Jerónimo's Group

texts.en:
Don Jerónimo and Don Luis Miguel work as cattle breeders in the community of "El Arca" in the state of Campeche.  

Working with cattle requires the whole family to get involved either in breeding, sales, or purchase of food.  This job has brought Don Jerónimo's 5 member family close together, and they enjoy spending time in each others' company.  They spend time together at night, using a candles and a car battery to light their household. 

By purchasing a solar home system, Don Jerónimo and his family will be able to replace the use of candles and batteries and improve the quality of light and the air they breathe.  Don Jerónimo has said he is very proud to be able to acquire solar technology for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home lighting system to replace the use of candles and car batteries

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim’s is a blacksmith by profession. He has been running this activity for the past seven years in the city of his residence and the nearby villages. Agim says, “There has been a growing demand for my services and the fact that I am the only one in the area practicing such skills has brought more clientele to me. However, I never took advantage of the fact that there is no competition in the field. Clients say that they are happy with my work, and I am happy serving them."

Agim is an Egyptian Albanian and as such, he is talented at what he is doing; note here that males of this minority are very handy. This loan will help Agim to repair the ceiling of his shop.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling of his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Janet's S. Group

texts.en:
Janet's S's group is located in Teshie Township. The group members are basically involved in the small-scale retail sale of vegetables (cabbage, carrot, lettuce, green pepper, onion), cassava, plantains, and braziers. They have an average age of 36 years and an average of two children. Janet S. is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three. Her main business is to supply vegetables (especially cabbage, carrots, lettuce, green peppers, and onions) to vegetable sellers in Accra. She buys the items from the central market and supplies them to customers in Accra. She has all three children going to school. She is standing in the middle of the photograph. 

Janet is sometimes supported by her husband, who is a businessman. Her main clients are basically vegetable traders in Accra. 

Janet is determined to use the loan request amount of 400 GHS from Kiva partner ID-Ghana to change her and her family's lives by investing it in her vegetable business. She is on the first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group need a total amount of 1,600 GHS so that they can increase stock and serve customers better.

loans.use: to supply vegetables, especially cabbage, carrots, lettuce, green peppers, and onions to vegetable sellers in Accra.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en: Korto lives in the Airport Community. She is 32 years old and single with two children, 3 and 5 years old. She did not attend school, but she manages her business well. For the past 11 years she has been cooking and selling rice and soup in her community market. She says that she spends 13 hours each day on her business since her business helps to sustain her home. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, fish, meat, charcoal, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educates her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, fish, meat, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 28 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married to a house-builder and they have five children, ages 1 to 12 years old. Only four of her children are attending school and they all live at home. Oretha did not have the opportunity to attend school but she tries to manage her business very well. She described herself as a hard-working woman. For the past seven years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo is 37 years old and lives in the Airport Community. She is married with five children, ages 7 to 18 years old. Her children live at home and attend school. For the past five years, she been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it keeps her saving every day. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business; this will enable her to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business,

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en:
Zhenya is from Ararat, Armenia. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, brother-in-law, and her five-year-old son. Zhenya’s mother-in-law is a school teacher and her brother-in-law is a construction worker. The family works hard in order to make ends meet. 

Zhenya, with the help of her family members, is involved in cattle breeding. In addition, she breeds hens and turkeys and is a beekeeper. She also cultivates tomatoes and watermelons. Farming is a very important source of income for her family. Her husband sells the agricultural products at the local market. 

The family currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers, beehives, and fuel for their agricultural machinery. Zhenya and her family rely on the goodwill and support of all of the lenders and is grateful for their help.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, beehives, fuel, and fertilizers

loans.name: Claudio

texts.pt:
Claúdio tem 32 anos é casado,  tem 3 filhos todos a estudar além dos filhos sustenta o seu irmão enviando. Ele é pedreiro e trabalha a conta própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo quer comprar cimento, ferro, alugar material de coferragem para colocar betão na sala da sua casa que está a fazer pessoalmente.
Para o futuro tem como projectos fazer um estabelecimento para vender produtos para melhor sustento de sua famíilia, terminar sua obra.
Diz ainda que irá pagar pontualmente as prestações e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar o seu projecto.
texts.en:
Claúdio is 32 years old and married. He has three children, all of whom study. Aside from his children he also supports his brother. He's a self-employed mason.
He states that with the amount of the loan he wishes to purchase cement and iron. He also wishes to rent formwork supplies so he can lay concrete on the living room of his house, which he's been building himself.
His projects for the future are to finish his construction work and set up a store so he can sell merchandise and better support his family.
He also states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans again so he can achieve his project.

loans.use: to purchase cement and iron, and to rent formwork supplies.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en: Famata from Liberia is 50 years old. She lives in one of the communities surrounding Airport. She is married with seven children, aged 15 to 30 years old. Only three of her children are in school and live at home. For the past twenty years she has been selling fish in her community market. She spends most of her time with her business since her business helps to sustain the family. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 24 years old. She lives in the Airport community and she is single with a 4-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. She is a 12th grade graduate. Over the past five years she has been selling fruit in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 32 years old and lives in the community of Airport.  She is married with two children who live at home and attend school.  For the past 9 years she has been selling gasoline along the roadside in her community.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned this way of selling from some boys who also sell gasoline.  She enjoys the business because of the experiences she received every day.  Her plan is to purchase more gasoline (to expand her business) and to build a gas station in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
Massa is 33 years old and lives in Airport, Margibi County.  This area has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia.  Massa is married to a driver and they have two children, ages 3 and 12 years old.  Their children are in school and live at home.  Massa’s parents did not send her to school, so she decided to do some business to improve her living conditions.  

For the past 15 years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market.  She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 8 hours each day on her business.  She started by selling rice, and her mother taught her how to do this business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business.  She enjoys how she saved money every time.  In the future she wants to build a house.  She thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Raquel Maria

texts.pt:
Raquel de 38 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 2 (dois)  filhos uma esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e autra sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è promotora de venda num estabelicimento do peixe da mama a mais de 7 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao ( cimento, chapas de zinco, cimento, ferro, blocos e pregos) para dar continidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 38 years old and single. She has two children, one of whom attends elementary school and the other daughter hasn't reached school age yet. She has been a sales promoter for one of the "O Peixe da Mamã" stores for over seven years.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, iron, bricks and nails) so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, iron, bricks and nails) so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en: Korpo lives in Airport of Margibi County, which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia.  For the past 10 years she has been selling used clothes in the market.  She started this business by selling used clothes for her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother.  She is 43 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 16 years old.  Her children are in school and live at home.  Her husband is a driver.  She is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish for her business.  She likes the buying from her customers.  Her plans are to expand her business and to see all of her children graduate.  She appreciates Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to buy more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en: Garmai is a 48-year-old widow who lives in Airport, Margibi County.  This area has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  She lives with her two children who attend school.  For the past 15 years she has been involved in a business selling milk, bread, soft drinks, etc.  She says that she uses a taxi every time to transport goods to her business.  She likes how her customers buy from her and she is proud of how she supports her family.  She learned this way of selling from her mother.  She sells for 10 hours each day, from Monday to Saturday.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, bread, and soft drinks for her business.  Her plan is to build her house.  She is glad to become a borrower of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, bread, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives in Airport, Margibi County. She is single. Although she didn't attend school, she is good at managing her business. Elizabeth has three children between the ages of 2 and 19, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past five years, Elizabeth has been selling red palm oil in the local market. She started her business with a small amount of money from her mother; she learned the business from her. She likes her business because people respond well to it. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more red palm oil for her business. She hopes to make more profits to help sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more red palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Dinis Filipe

texts.pt:
Dinis de 58 anos de idade, casa e pai de 13 filhos dos quais 10 (dez) são independentes e 3 (tres) estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ele è jardineiro numa empresa de producao de banana  è tambem criador de frangos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar racao, pintos, vitaminas para aumentar o volume de criacao de pintos na sua casa, actividade que vem exercendo a mais de 20 anos junto com a sua esposa.
texts.en:
Dinis is 58 years old and married. He has 13 children, ten of whom are independent and three attend primary and secondary school.
He's a gardener for a banana company and also raises chickens.
The current loan will be used to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins so he can expand the chicken raising business he runs in his house. He has been in this line of work for over 20 years alongside his wife.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins so he can expand the chicken raising business he runs in his house.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is a young farmer from the village of Arevshat in Ararat, Armenia. He lives with his mother and sister. 

Hayk is the only breadwinner of the family. To meet his family's everyday needs, he is engaged in cultivating tomatoes and fruits (peach, apricot, and quince).  His mother and sister assist him greatly in his horticultural activities. Hayk and his family also make dried fruit, which he sells at the local market. Dried fruit is in high demand, especially during the winter season. 

To be able to continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hayk needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fruits and walnuts to make dried fruit. He and his family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and walnuts to make dried fruit

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old. She lives in the community surrounding Airport, Liberia. She did not attend school. Martha is single and has four children who are between the ages of six and twenty-five years old. Two of her children are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, Martha has been selling fish at the local market. She started this business by selling fish for her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kou from Airport, Margibi County, Liberia.  This area has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia.  She is unmarried and has four children, between the ages of 2 and 15 years old, who live at home.  Three of her children attend school.

Her fiancée is a security guard.  For the past 4 years she has been selling items (plantains, oil, etc.)  in the local market.  She started this business with little money from her fiancée and learned the ways of selling from her mother.  Most often she used bus transportation to transport her goods.  She likes the flow of her customers and enjoys the profits she makes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, oil, etc. for her business.  Her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains and oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is from Liberia. She lives in the community surrounding Airport in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 38 years old and has three children between 9 and 18 years old. All her children are in school and live at home. For over five years, she has been involved in a business in the local market selling used clothes. Her Aunty taught her how to sell and assisted her with money. She makes more profit because she has more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Macagnes

texts.en: Macagnes is 26 years old and lives with her boyfriend in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. For six years now, she has been selling soap, mouthwash, slippers, clothes, spray, delta, etc at her shop in the community. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more soap, mouthwash, slippers, clothes, spray, delta, etc. for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more soap, mouthwash, slippers, clothes, spray, delta, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Please meet Mamie, a 42-year-old woman who resides with her children in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  She is unmarried and has four children between 9 and 24 years old, all of whom are attending school. Her fiance helped her with a little money to establish a business selling doughnuts two years ago.  Her Aunty taught her how to fix and sell doughnuts. She makes more profit and her business makes her popular. She is asking for a loan to buy more oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is 48 years old and a widow with four children between 22 and 35 years old. Only one of her children lives at home and attends school. For the past 10 years, she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc in the local market. She spends eight hours each day on her business, six days in a week. Generally, she uses a taxi to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business,

loans.name: Kona

texts.en: Kona is 41 years old. She lives and works in Margibi County, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married to a heavy duty operator. She stopped her education at the 7th grade. She has three children between 2 and 15 years old who live at home and attend school. Over the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money from her husband and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her dream is to build a decent house and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kimphearek

texts.en:
Residing in the Kampong Svay District of Kampong Thom Province, Kimphearek is 22 years old and single. Kimphearek has struggled to make a living through working as a security guard. He has been engaged in his job for almost one year.

He is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund. He is requesting an education loan to pay for his university fees for four years, studying Management. He hopes that the loan will enable him to stay in university to pursue his degree so he can find a better job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees for four years

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from clothing sales. Regina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell to customers.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia is a 67-year-old married woman with eight children. She makes and sells meat buns and donuts in her community to earn a living. She has two businesses. Muia needs a loan to buy flour, chicken, soy sauce, onion, baking soda and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to extend her business.

Muia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, soy sauce, onion, baking soda and plastic bags.

loans.name: Samafuao

texts.en:
Samafuao is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows banana and taro to earn a living. Samafuao has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, barbed wire, bush-knives and an axe for her business.

She has been a member of SPBD in 2013. Samafuao will spend her profit to help her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, barbed wire, bush knives and an axe.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Phon, age 26 and married, is a mother of three children residing in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. To support her family, especially in covering the daily basic needs, she grows rice on two hectares' area and sells grocery items to supplement her income. These are the businesses that she has had for several years.

Now, she has formed a group of four to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader.  For the past two loans, she has fully paid them back with success; this has enabled her to improve her livelihood and make her life better than before. For this cycle, she will use her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can make good profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: María Arminda

texts.es:
María de 42 años, vive junto a su esposo, persona que se dedica al servicio de transporte con un pick up, han procreado tres hijos.

Ella aprendió a elaborar  tortillas en su casa,  cuando tenía 12 años de edad y las pupusas hace 15 años, cuando trabajo como empleada de otra persona, Hoy trabaja de forma independiente y hace pupusas los días viernes y sábados, cada día vende $20.00 dólares,  en el negocio de tortillas es de todos los días, vende $12.00. La rentabilidad del negocio que ella hace es del  65 % en promedio

El préstamo será invertido en: $400.00 en la reparación del vehículo (compra de la palangana o carrocería) y $200.00 en la compra de mesas  y sillas para la atención de sus clientes y $300.00, para comprar una nueva plancha y utilizarlo como capital de trabajo.

Con la inversión, reparara  la carrocería del vehículo que es importante para esta familia, gran parte de sus ingresos se generan con el servicio de transporte que hacen; también, quieren iniciar con la comercialización de frutas y verduras, y planean hacerlo en las diferentes comunidades de la ciudad, al comprar mesas y sillas para su negocio, espera brindar mejor comodidad a sus clientes y obtener preferencias, y el capital de trabajo para que emprendan sus labores.

Al mejorar  las  condiciones de sus  equipos de trabajos, se espera que tengan mejores oportunidades de ventas y esto signifique mayores utilidades comerciales, esperando que sus condiciones de vida mejoren.

Desea, luchar en el negocio, esforzándose,  para apoyar a su hija en el estudio académico y poder comprar un terreno para hacer su casa.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and she lives with her husband who works in transportation with a pick-up truck. They have 3 children together. María learned to make tortillas at home when she was 12 years old, and she learned to make the stuffed corn tortillas called pupusas when she was 15 while she was working for someone else.

Today she works independently and makes pupusas Fridays and Saturdays, selling $20.00 each day and she makes tortillas every day, selling $12.00. The profitability of her business is 65% on average.

She will invest the loan as follows: $400.00 to repair her vehicle (purchase of vehicle's body), $200.00 to purchase tables and chairs to better serve her clients and $300.00 to purchase a new griddle and as working capital. With this loan, she will repair the body work of her vehicle which is important to her family, a great part of her income is generated with the transportation service they are able to provide. María also wants to start putting fruits and vegetables on the market and they plan to do this in different neighborhoods in their city. By purchasing tables and chairs for her business, María hopes to make her customers more comfortable and to obtain their loyalty. The working capital is to help her get started. 

By improving the condition of her work equipment, she hopes that she'll have a better opportunity to make sales. This would mean greater returns, and she hopes this will improve their quality of life. She wants to work hard in her business and make efforts in order to help her daughter in her studies and so that she can purchase land to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle's body, to purchase tables, chairs and a new griddle and have working capital

loans.name: Boravy

texts.en: Boravy is 35 years old. She is widowed and resides with her mother and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her mother sells second-hand clothes and earns about $9 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. To improve her family’s transportation, Boravy is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house and help her children earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie runs her general store properly and she was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC. Norie lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her family.

Her determination to send her two children to school and finish their course is the reason she works even more. She helps her husband in managing their farm for it is their main source of income. She is borrowing a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizer. 

In the future, Norie wants to build house and to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
This is Mamerta. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney motor vehicle for her transportation business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a tailoring business.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mamerta hopes to be healthy and have a long and satisfied life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

Note: All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is the breadwinner in a family consisting of three children. She is 56 years old and a widow. For the sake of her family, she tailors clothes at home as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business since she was 20 years old. The current business has generated her about 16,700 KHR per day.

Including this loan, she and another borrower in the same group have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) at least five cycles. For Phalla, she has repaid her past loans with success to provide the three decent meals for family. Now, she and her joint member are seeking a loan.

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a sewing machine and fabric to support her business. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business to improve her lifestyle progressively.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to support her business.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Bopha is a rural villager from Kandal province, who is 46 years old and married with three children. All of them are still in school and dependent on their parents. Bopha has been rice farming for 10 years with the support of her husband. This is Bopha’s fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva partner). The previous loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her to sustain her living conditions and support her business. This time she is seeking a loan to cover her son's entire school tuition fees. Bopha hopes that the loan will help her son to obtain a higher education qualification so that he can get a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fees of her son

loans.name: Bunthy's Group

texts.en:
Bunthy is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a rural village in the Moung Russey district. Rice farming is the main source of family income and he has been farming rice for about 10 years. To supplement his income, he also sells dessert in the village. The current business earns his family a daily income of about KHR 32,000 and he is able to save KHR 18,000 each day. 

This is the eighth loan for Bunthy with Kiva partner, VisionFund. With the successful previous loans, he has been able to better support his family. He is now leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en: Samet is a 33-year-old mother of five dependent children who lives in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is one of her family's breadwinners and farms rice as her main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years, earning almost 35,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. Including this loan, she has become a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loans which she has repaid, she feels confident that she can steadily improve her living conditions. Now she is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her crop. She hopes to achieve triple the yield she did last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
This is Juan. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.  

He would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, to maintain their tricycle unit and to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs and the educational expenses of his son. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. Juan dreams that his business will grow bigger and his son will finish his studies. He is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps him to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows him to learn more about the love of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Am, age 50 and a father of five children, is a villager residing in Ksach Kandal district of Kandal Province, Cambodia. His entire family relies solely on his income-generating activities. Supported by his wife, he has been raising rice for 30 years, and he earns almost $9 per day. Am is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is applying for an education loan to cover school fees for his son, who is pursuing his bachelor's degree with a major in Mathematics Teaching. Am hopes that this financial support will help his son to pay more attention to his studies and get good grades so that he can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To cover his son's school fees

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon is a single lady in her early 20s residing in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province.  Her main sources of income are from her job working at a local factory and her clothes selling business. She has had this business for 6 years. Sokhon is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’ s partner). She is now seeking a loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to her workplace. She hopes that this purchase has enabled her to minimize transportation costs which she used to pay.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting to her workplace

loans.name: Kimhy

texts.en:
Kimhy, a rural villager from Kandal province's Ksach Kandal district where rice farming is a popular business, is 50 years old and has four children. Kimhy is a rice farmer while her husband is a paid construction worker. Having engaged in this business for 20 years, Kimhy is able to save up to 15 US dollars per day from her current business after deducting expenses. 

This is a fourth-cycle loan for Kimhy with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past business loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as improving her business in a gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her son, specializing in Finance and Banking. She sincerely hopes that this loan will enable her to send her oldest son to university and also help her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee

loans.name: Sauafa

texts.en:
Sauafa is a 54-year-old widow with 8 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, banana, and yams to earn a living. 

Sauafa has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chain saw, and chemicals. She will use her profits to assist her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chain saw, and chemicals.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is 33 years old and single. Marvie works very hard to provide for her needs and the needs of her parents as well.

Marvie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items. She has asked for a 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more goods like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

In the future, Marvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh would like to take a further loan, which she will use to buy a greater number of gas tanks to sell, and to buy a scooter to better deliver the tanks to her customers. Oanh sells gas tanks in addition to operating a food stall which remains her primary income-generating activity.

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase gas tanks to sell, and to buy a scooter for transporting the tanks

loans.name: Bunroeng

texts.en:
Residing in the Samroung district of Odor Meanchey province, Bunroeng is 25 years old and married. He has three kids, all of whom are too young for school. He has struggled to make a living through for farming rice and working as a teacher for five years. He is able to earn about $17 US per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Bunroeng’s first micro-loan with VisionFund. Now he is applying for an education loan to pay for the school fees for him to study Finance and Banking. He hopes that the loan will enable him to pursue the degree at university so as to find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for the school fees for him to study Finance and Banking

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek, 53, is married with four children and lives in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She’s been growing rice and beans for over 30 years. Agriculture has always been her major source of income. She also has a milling machine at her home to provide a milling service to the local farmers in exchange for rice, beans and money.

To help her maintain her business, Sek is requesting a loan to buy diesel fuel for her milling machine. She would like to continually provide her service, and this will improve income. Her goal is to expand her farmland and make it more productive. She hopes to give her family more financial stability, give her children a better education and improve the whole family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase diesel fuel for her milling machine to continually offer her milling service.
