loans.name: La Buena Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group La Buena Fe ("The Good Faith") 1 & 2. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, a sleepy agricultural town. The group comprises ten micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling different products and services. Marta makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five children. 

Marta is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products. She intends to use the loan capital to purchase cosmetics, jewels, clothes, shoes, and other items. She will use the profits to save and to reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, jewels, clothes, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling spices and dried fish. Amalia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to build her business further.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Seat, 51, is married and lives with her husband and seven children in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers who grow rice and raise pigs. Seat has been in these businesses for three years.

Seat’s group consists of two members, both of whom are female. She is a first-cycle client with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Seat, who is the leader of this group, will use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for nourishing her pigs

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa lives with her long-term partner and their five children in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. She has run her business, Fantasia (a little store where she sells cosmetics, jewels and other products) for over six years, having started it with her first loan she took with Esperanza. Her most recent loan was invested in the business. 

This is Santa's 12th loan which she will use to finish building her house. Many years ago, Santa started building her house with her business profits, over time she has been able to build her house little by little. Now She wants to invest this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, concrete blocks, rods, and other building materials. She currently has a mostly wood structure home and she will build but her new home will be safer and more secure with bricks and blocks as you can see in the photo. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in repaying their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings. Santa thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to you for your support!

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cements, tiles and other building materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Nayar

texts.en:
Nayar is a 24 year woman and raises 3 children. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has a clothes shop, and has about three years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person with this. 

Nayar usually sells clothes in the central bazaar. People buy her clothes and are happy with her dealings. Doing clothing sales requires a lot of strength and work in central bazaar, which is very hard for women, and that is why her daughter helps her as well. 

She wants to increase her monthly sales so she needs additional capital to invest in her ready made clothes business. This will allow her to improve the quality of products. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC. She is hopeful that this amount will bring positive change to her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy new clothing varieties to sell

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina has a housing loan from Esperanza International. This is her 5th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had s household products sales business for over five years,which she starting with her own savings. With her last loan, she increased inventory.

Katerina is a single mother of one child.  She works and lives in the rural town in San Pedro de Macoris. She will use this loan to buy cement to cover her concrete block walls and also will buy windows and doors to finish building her house.

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time running their business and attending their group meetings. Katerina thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy doors, windows, and cement to finish building her house

loans.name: Sharef

texts.en:
Sharef is 50 years old; he lives with his wife and his 5 children in Jinn. He has a garage for repairing vehicle and motors, and he earns a monthly income of $1350. He started his business thirteen years ago, and he has more than 30 years experience.

Sharef is asking Ryada for this loan to buy new, modern equipment which will make his work easier and faster. That will bring more clients and allow him to increase his income. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy new, modern equipment for his garage.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba with his brother and his parents. Mahmoud is in his 1st year of studying for a Bachelor of Literature degree. He is planning to continue his study to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
Raad is 21 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his four siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man who currently works in agriculture. 

Raad is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting, third year. He is planning to continue his study to work in his study field after graduation in order to start helping his family financially. They are currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping them in paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 high school aged children. She lives in Sepac Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. Marina has had a Sari-sari Store for almost 10 years, earning a monthly income of 3000 PHP.  Marina requested a new loan to purchase various groceries, beverages and rice for resale. Marina has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years. She dreams that her children will be able to graduate and live the lives that they choose in the future. She hopes to keep more savings from her business to sustain their livelihood and to provide for her childrens' needs.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries and beverages

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 30-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales for the past four years. She has two buffaloes and one goat. She looks after the cattle while her husband performs the task of selling them in the market. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

Sumera has four children, who all go to school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make larger profits, Sumera has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy two more goats. She is currently in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good credit behavior in the past. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to buy two more goats.

loans.name: Radha Devi

texts.en:
Radha Devi is a 45-year-old married woman with three children who lives in the Parsa tole of Kalaiya Municipality of Bara district Nepal. She has a pharmacy shop where she sells medicines to fellow community people. She has a very good personal reputation within her community, so many customers come to her pharmacy to buy different types of medicine.

She has requested a loan amount of Nepalese Rupees 40,000 to increase the different types of medicines stocked in her shop. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to support the needs of her family and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy a stock of medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. His father is the main income source for the family, and he cooperates with him to supplement the family’s income. 

Hussein has been working as a plumber since 2010. He works on his own; taking on multiple projects, and serving individuals at their domiciles whenever they are facing problems with sanitation, tubes, faucets, etc. New tools will be acquired after receiving the youth loan that he is asking for from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l.

In the future, he plans to open his own shop and sell plumbing tools and supplies.

loans.use: to acquire new tools.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
José Luis strives to be the model farmer. He's proud of his animals and crops and it shows in how healthy they look and in the organization readily apparent to anyone who sets foot on his farm. It's also apparent that he runs everything on a shoestring budget. He is investing in a 16 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa bio-digester to save more money, save the environment, and serve as an example within his community of how things can be done without having to resort to fossil fuels and expensive agro-chemical fertilizers.

His system will convert the abundant supply of manure produced by his dairy cows into renewable bio-gas and potent bio-fertilizer. His family will use the bio-gas in the Biobolsa stove included in the biodigester kit to replace the liquefied petroleum gas they currently use to cook and heat bathwater. José Luis will start using the bio-fertilizer to his plot to regenerate the soil and improve farm yields without spending money on fossil-fuel based fertilizers. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa bio-digester and two burner stove.

loans.use: to pay for a 16 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa bio-digester and the included stove

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is the mother of four children, and they live with her and her long-term partner. She works and lives in the rural town in San Pedro de Macoris. She will use this loan to buy cement, tiles and a door (shutter) for her Food store business. Alexandra has requested a housing loan and is from the city of San Pedro de Macoris. This is her sixth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her food store and a decoration business for over seven years. With her last loan, she increased her store's inventory, where she sells food like rice, beans, sugar, and other goods and her decoration business where she sells stuff for home decorations. 

Esperanza International Dominican Republic runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown fidelity to their groups. The program allows them to take out loans to improve the structure of their houses, while running their businesses and attending their group meetings. She thanks God, Esperanza International Dominican Republic and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy tiles and a shutter for her business

loans.name: Runchi Devi

texts.en:
Runchi is 45-year-old married woman with three sons. They live in the Kalaiya Municipality of Bara district, Nepal. Within her own house, Runchi has set up a small general store shop where she sells different types of products such as rice, pulse, and sugar to her fellow community members. She has good number of customers who come to her store to buy different type of goods. As a result of the success of her store, she feels it is time to expand her general store with a wider range of products. 

Runchi is requesting a 40,000 NPR loan to purchase grain, pulses, and other products. She has very good personal references within her community. Runchi’s hope for the future is to do well in business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to pay for purchasing grain, pulses, and other products to increase the stock to sell in her shop

loans.name: Indu Devi

texts.en:
Indu Devi is 57 years old, married and has 2 sons, two of them are in business. She is a hard working woman. For the past 9 years, Indu Devi has been selling different types of mobile phones in the local market with help from her son. She is doing well in mobile phone selling.  As mobile coverage is increasing in rural areas, she is getting more demands for mobile phones.

Indu Devi has requested a loan amount of 50,000 Nepalese Rupees to increase her stock of different brand mobiles phones so that she can meet the increasing  demand by offering a variety of mobile phones to her customers. In the future, she would like to expand her business and continue adding wealth to live in prosperity.

loans.use: buy mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their household. Currently, Naseem has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: La Provincia Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras una de ellas es Tania tiene la edad de 19 años, casada, con un hijo en camino, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos generales y por catálogos de Vogue y Zermat  desde hace 3  años, sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como crema corporal, shampoo, tintes para el cabello, cremas facial, bloqueadores, maquillaje. Celina tiene la edad de 49 años su negocio es una pulpería desde hace año y medio y Yessenia  tiene la edad de 34 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace año y medio.
texts.en: This group consists of three hardworking women who are fighters. One of the members is Tania, who is 19 years old, married and has a son on the way. She has made a living selling general cosmetics and Vogue and Zermat catalog items in her community for the past three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase products like body and facial creams, shampoos, hair dyes, sun block and makeup. Celina is 49 years old and has had a convenience store for a year and a half, and Yessenia is 34 and has made a living selling tortillas for a year and a half.

loans.use: to purchase body and facial creams, shampoos, hair dyes, sun block and makeup.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 45-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. She stitches the garments with the help of needy women living in her locality, in this way she indirectly helps the needy women and earns income for her family. All the ladies are sewing clothes with love and good spirits.

Nowadays, two more needy women want to join their company, but there are no more sewing machines available for them. Therefore, Najma requested a loan so that she could buy two more sewing machines to provide a source of income to both ladies to create a means of increasing revenue.

Najma hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her and for all needy women. Najma says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: Mehfooz A Aziz Group

texts.en:
Mehfooz is 60 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her eight children. She requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. This amount will help her to expand her husband's auto workshop by purchasing a variety of auto parts which are required.

She wants the financing to invest in the expansion of her husband's workshop, which is the only source of income for their family. 

She believes in working together (with her husband) and honesty and is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to their business and will increase monthly profits.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of auto parts

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Waleed works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself. He owns a small shop where he sells stationery, desk supplies, and books, etc. He established his business three months ago and has gained good experience in this field. Waleed now has one employee hired and is becoming well known for copying book reports for his customers.

Waleed is requesting a loan to purchase a copier machine, stationery and copying requirements. Waleed aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide a good life for his family.

Waleed with his business is just one of many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to purchase a copier machine, stationery and copying requirements.

loans.name: Fany Margarita

texts.es:
Fany, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de licuados, golosinas y bisutería, comprara ingredientes para los licuados (leche, naranjas, zanahorias, guineos, etc.), diversificara las golosinas y material para bisutería que ofrece a sus clientes. Tuvo resultados positivos con el crédito anterior que le ayudaron a generar más ingresos, ampliar su negocio y tener clientes nuevos.
Su núcleo familiar es el mismo, ella ya cuenta con trabajo fijo  y el negocio está siendo administrado por su madre, sus condiciones de vida son mucho mejores.
texts.en:
Fany is requesting a new loan to invest in her business of smoothies, sweets and costume jewelry.  She will buy ingredients for the smoothies (milk, orange, carrots, bananas, etc.), a variety of sweets, and materials to make costume jewelry.  She obtained positive results from the previous loan as it helped generate more income, expand business and attract new customers.

Her family situation is the same.  She has a permanent job and the business is being managed by her mother, so her living conditions are much better.

loans.use: To buy smoothie ingredients (milk, oranges, carrots, bananas, etc.), a variety of sweets and materials to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Unido Group

texts.es:
Ida, es una mujer emprendedora, originaria de la ciudad de Bilwi, casada y con 6 hijos. Desde hace 5 años vende en el mercado mondongo, pellejo, carne de cerdo y bastimentos como: yuca, malanga, quequisque, plátanos, bananos, filipitas. 

Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar 3 cerdos, engordarlos y después vender su carne y obtener más ganancias. Ella está luchando por lograr mejorar el local donde tiene su venta de productos, actualmente está en mal estado; su mayor anhelo es construirlo de cemento.

John, es un señor amable, cuya principal actividad económica y fuente de ingreso es su taller de ebanistería, fabrica muebles de madera por encargo. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar máquinas para el taller que le faciliten elaborar muebles con mayor rapidez y calidad.

Marcela, es una señora jovial, tiene un tramo en el mercado de Bilwi donde vende granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz, yuca, malanga, quequisque, plátanos, bananos. Solicita financiamiento para surtir su tienda con otros productos que demanda la población.
texts.en:
Ida is an entrepreneur from the city of Bilwi who is married and has six children.  For five years she has been running her market stall selling pork meat and other goods such as yucca plant, malanga (edible root), quequisque (coco yam), bananas and filipitas.

She is requesting a loan to buy three pigs to fatten and then sell at her shop.  She is struggling to improve the stall where she works since it is in disrepair.  She wants to build a stand out of cement.

John is a kind man who earns a living with his carpentry business.  He makes furniture on an order basis and plans to use the loan to buy machinery for his workshop so he can improve the quality of his products and shorten delivery time.

Marcela is a cheerful woman who has a stand at the Bilwi market where she sells basic goods: rice, beans, corn, yucca plant, malanga, quequisque, and bananas.  She wants a loan to stock her business with other products in popular demand.

loans.use: To buy three pigs for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda es una joven de 23 años, está casada con Zosimo y tiene una hija de 2 años que viven con ella en su casa hecha de adobe . Hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura y producción de cacao orgánico en su parcela de 1 hectárea que compró con ayuda de su pareja y sus padres por ser muy trabajadora. Al iniciarse en esta actividad contó siempre con el apoyo de su esposo realizando las tareas cotidianas con el objetivo de lograr que sus cultivos frutos de calidad. Uno de los principales inconvenientes que afectaron su labor fue el ataque de plagas que intentaron perjudicarlo, sin embargo gracias a charla informativas y asesoramiento por parte de una entidad agraria logro manejar el problema de la manera mas adecuada y sin complicaciones. Para obtener una mejor calidad de frutos en cada campaña suele aplicar abono orgánico a sus cultivos. Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva y agradece por la confianza que les brinda a otros agricultores de su zona como ella. En esta ocasión desea solicitar S/.1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 23, is married to Zosimo and they have a two-year-old daughter.  The family lives in an adobe house.  For five years Herlinda has been involved in agriculture and organic cocoa production on the one-acre patch of land she bought with help from her husband and her parents, because of her hard work.  Since starting the activity she has always had the support of her husband in the daily chores in an effort to produce a quality crop.  One of the main challenges they have had to face was a plague affecting the crop; but thanks to informative talks and advice from an agriculture entity, they managed to overcome the problem without complications.

In order to obtain a better harvest each season, Herlinda treats the soil with organic fertilizer.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the confidence shown in farmers in the area, like herself.  She is requesting 1,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Talula Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias de éxito una de ellas es Soraya tiene la edad de 31 años, casada, con dos hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de sopa de mondongo desde hace 7 años, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materia prima como leña, yuca, repollo, quequisque, mondongo, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate,ayote, chayote, naranja agria etc. Jeysi tiene la edad de 44 años su negocio es la venta de café, pan y leche ambulante y María tiene la edad de 50 años su negocio es taller de costura y bordado en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Talula group is comprised of three successful members, one of whom is Soraya.  She is 31 years old, married and has two minor children.  She has been in business selling tripe soup for seven years and has been a client of the institution for five years.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as firewood, yucca plant, cabbage, tuber, tripe, onion, sweet pepper, tomato, squash, bitter orange, etc.

Jeysi, 44, is a street vendor and sells coffe, bread and milk.  Maria, 50, has a sewing and embroidery shop that she runs from home.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old married to Alice. Together they are blessed with two children ages thirteen and five years old.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu njeru which he has been running for ten years with an average monthly income of ksh 48,000. He has applied for a second loan from Kadet ltd after paying his previous loan successfully. This loan will enable him to buy stocks of sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc. With the anticipated profit he plans to add more inventory.

In the near future, he hopes to boost his business to increase his income and uplift his family living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 42 años, vive junto a sus tres hijos: una hija de 19 años de edad, que estudia el cuarto ciclo en licenciatura en comunicaciones en la universidad (becaria) y es locutora en una radio en la ciudad; un varón de 17 años, graduado de bachillerato general, este desde los 11 años se dedica a la música y es miembro de la banda del colegio, aprendió de la música con el papá en la 3ª. Brigada de infantería (cuartel Militar); también, vive con  una hija de 9 años de edad, que estudia 3ª grado.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de tamales y atoles, tres veces por semana hace atoles de diferentes productos, en promedio vende $17.33 por día,  los días lunes hace $35.00 dólares de tamales para  la venta, los días viernes y sábado hace empanadas, en promedio $30.00 por día. Vende sus productos yendo de casa en casa, por la colonia  donde reside y en las comunidades vecinas. La materia prima para sus productos las adquiere en el mercado municipal de la ciudad,  y hace un  recorrido de 5 kilómetros aproximadamente en buses. 

El préstamo servirá para adecuar el área de cocina en el patio de la vivienda; pues, la familia está afrentando enfermedades respiratorias, por el exceso de humedad y  de humo dentro de la vivienda.  

 
 Al no cocinar dentro de la vivienda, se espera que los padecimientos de alergias, por el exceso de humo y la humedad que genera el cocinar dentro se disminuya.


Desea, seguir con el  negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, para que puedan seguir con sus estudios, especialmente al hijo para que estudie la licenciatura en música en la capital.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, lives with her three children: a 19-year-old daughter who studies communications at the university, where she is in her fourth year, and works as a radio announcer in the city; a 17-year-old son who has a high school diploma and has been involved in music since the age of 11 and is a member of the school band (He learned music from his father who is in the Third Infantry Brigade); and her nine-year-old daughter who is in third grade.
 
Maria makes and sells tamales and "atoles" (drinks).  Three times a week she makes drinks out of different products and sells an average $17.33 worth a day.  On Mondays she takes in $35.00 from sales of tamales.  And on Fridays and Saturdays she makes empananas (meat pies), with average daily sales being $30.00.  She sells her products door-to-door throughout the community where she lives and in neighboring communities.  She buys the ingredients for her products at the municipal market in the city, which is about 5 kilometers away by bus.

The loan will be used to install a kitchen area on the patio of her house because the family is suffering from respiratory illnesses due to the excess humidity and smoke inside the house.  By not cooking inside the house she hopes the allergies due to to excess smoke and humidity from the cooking will diminish.

She wants to continue with her business to support her children so they can continue with their education, especially her son who is studying toward a music degree in the capital city.

loans.use: To install a new kitchen.

loans.name: Joyce Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Joyce del Carmen habita en Managua, tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene un bebe en quien ha dedicado todo su esfuerzo por culminar sus estudios universitarios.  En la actualidad Joyce se encuentra culminando su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, la cual a pesar de estar embarazada no los ha interrumpido. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora, ya que esta es una importante e indispensable herramienta de estudio y trabajo que le permitirá adquirir mayor experiencia y competir con otros profesionales de su misma área.
texts.en:
Young Joyce del Carmen lives in Managua. She is 22, married and has a baby, who is the reason why she has put a lot of effort into finishing her university studies. Joyce is currently in the last phase of her Computer Engineering studies, and she has not interrupted them, despite her pregnancy.

She is requesting a loan to buy a computer, which is an important and indispensable study and work tool that will help her acquire more experience and be more competitive in her professional field.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Ilsia, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para compra de leña, maíz, queso, telas, zippers, hilos, etc., todo lo necesario para mantener activa su actividad económica, con el préstamo anterior adquirió los insumos necesarios para seguir trabajando, con la mejora que ha tenido en sus ingresos incluyo la venta de queso.
Su núcleo familiar sigue siendo el mismo, su negocio no le ha dado ningún problema, todos están muy saludables y sus hijos siguen siendo apoyados en sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ilsia is requesting a new loan in order to buy firewood, corn, cheese, fabric, zippers, thread, etc.  All of these items are necessary for her to actively maintain her tortilla and sewing businesses.  With the previous loan, she was able to purchase the necessary supplies in order to continue working.  Her income has increased because she is now also selling cheese.

Her family continues to feel the same; her businesses have not presented any problems and all of her family members are healthy.  Her children continue to feel supported in having their needs met.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, cheese, fabric, zippers, thread, etc.

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José de 24 años, vive junto con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 4 años  de edad. Convive con la suegra. Tienen, 4 años de estar acompañados. Se graduó de bachiller General.

Después de graduarse de bachiller, presentó currículum en una Farmacia y fue aceptado, trabaja en este  lugar desde hace más de 3 años y goza de la confianza de la empresa y se desempeña como cajero.

El préstamo servirá para comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento y hierro, esto es para edificar una habitación que les permita, tener su espacio íntimo familiar.

El préstamo permitirá  a esta pareja,  convivir con mejor plenitud, gozar de un espacio de privacidad, donde puedan  solucionar sus problemas sin dificultad.

Él desea estudia licenciatura en comunicaciones en la Universidad.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old. He lives with his life's companion and a 4 year old son. They live with his mother in  law and have been together for 4 years. He graduated from high school. 

After graduating from high school, he gave his resume to a pharmacy and was accepted. He has worked there for more than 3 years and has the business' trust. He works as  a cashier.

The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement and iron. This is to build a room that will allow them to have private family space. The loan will allow this couple to live more fully and have some privacy where they can solve their problems without difficulty. 

He wants to major in communications at the university.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement and iron in order to build a room that will allow them to have private family space.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada, tiene un hijo y reside en La Masica, Atlántida. Siempre se a dedicado al comercio, lleva 8 años de vender achinería, cosméticos, bisutería, ropa, lociones, joyas etc. La mercadería la vende por pedidos o encargos y entrega a domicilio. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para su actividad de negocio, el préstamo que solicito actualmente es el ciclo numero 12, el cual es por 22,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas mercadería para la venta como ropa, aretes, pulceras, cadenas, lociones, cosméticos, bisutería y otros encargos,y va utilizar un 20% para cancelar una deuda adquirida en otra institución en donde paga muchos intereses. Su meta es crecer con el negocio, incrementar las ventas y así poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old. She is married, has a son and lives in La Masica, Atlántida. She has always worked as a merchant. She has been selling miscellaneous items, cosmetics, costume jewelry, clothes, lotions, jewelry, etc. for 8 years. She sells the merchandise on order and delvers to people's homes. She has taken out several loans for her business activity. The loan she has taken out now is her 12th cycle. It is for 22,000 Lempiras and she is going to invest it in buying more merchandise to sell such as clothes, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, lotions, cosmetics, costume jewelry and more. She will use 20% to pay off a loan she acquired in another institution where she pays a lot of interests. Her goal is to grow her business, increasing sales and thus obtaining more profits.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as clothes, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, lotions, cosmetics, costume jewelry, and more. She will use 20% to pay off a debt acquired in another institution.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES AL PROGRESO” está conformado  por 08 socias y socios que se encuentran muy contentos por estar pasando el 04 ciclo. Andrea tiene 45 años es soltera con 02 hijos educando hace varios años implemento un restaurant en su vivienda en el  cual ofrece desayuno almuerzo. Y a la vez se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Su mayor deseo es implementar su  restaurant con la venta de cerveza y gaseosas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres: pollo, verduras, tubérculos arroz, aceite.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Andrea es la que se encuentra incluida en la parte superior derecha que no puedo estar presente en la reunión del grupo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres al Progreso group is comprised of eight male and female members who are very happy to be in their fourth cycle.  

Andrea is forty-five years old, and is single with two children.  For several years she has had a restaurant that she runs in part of her home; she offers both breakfast and lunch.  At the same time, she also sells beauty products.  Her greatest dream is to provide beer and carbonated beverages at the restaurant.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies, including chicken, green vegetables, root vegetables, rice, and oil.

The entire group is grateful to the Kiva investors and for the loan.  Andrea is the individual pictured in the upper right hand corner; she could not be present at this particular group meeting.

loans.use: to buy chicken, root vegetables, green vegetables, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Irsa Dolores

texts.es: Irsa, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 3 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa como camisas, jeans, short, blusas, ropa interior, etc. esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante ofrece de casa en casa el producto. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el tercer ciclo y es por un monto de 8,000 Lempira con el cual va comprar mas productos  para la venta como ser pantalones, blusas, camisetas y vestidos, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos. Su meta es establecer el negocio en un local fijo y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Irsa, 46, is a single mother. She has two children and lives in Macuelizo, a municipality located in Santa Bárbara. She has been selling clothes (e.g. shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses and underwear) for three years as a street vendor, selling door-to-door.

This is Irsa’s third cycle and she is requesting a loan of 8,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy more products to sell, such as pants, blouses, shirts and dresses, with the intention to increase her income. Her goal is to have her own establishment, where she can run her business and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as pants, blouses, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Diego Arleison

texts.es:
Diego es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, el es trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos Diego no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Diego trabaja como operario en manejo de maquinas sopladoras en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Diego se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una moto lineal de segunda mano, la cual utilizara para transportarse desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta su trabajo, de esta manera el podrá ahorrar un poco de dinero,así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño mejorar la vivienda de sus padres para brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Diego is a young man, he is 19 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Pucallpa. He is hard-working, enthusiastic and devotes all his efforts to get ahead, but unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, Diego was unable to study a professional career. 

On his own initiative, Diego works as a blower operator in a commercial company in his city. He works for about 10 hours every day and believes he does well because of his dedication and his effort. 

Diego is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the support provided, he will be able to buy a second hand motorcycle. He will use the motorcycle to commute from his home, which is in a remote area, to work. By this he will be able to save money. He will continue to work hard and strive to achieve his great dream, which is to improve his parents’ home and to provide greater security and well-being for his parents.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, opta por otro crédito para su negocio de venta de mariscos. Lo invertirá en la compra de pescados, camarones, conchas, etc., frescos que le ayuden a mantener sus clientes satisfechos. Con el capital que se facilito ella pudo surtir el negocio y ha seguido trabajando sin ningún problema.
La familia de María sigue luchando junto a ella para salir adelante con el negocio y seguir mejorando su entorno.
texts.en:
María chooses to take out another loan for her seafood business. She will use it to buy fresh fish, fresh shrimp, fresh shellfish, etc. which will help her to keep her customers satisfied. With the capital she has obtained she could stock her business and has continued to work without any problems.

María and her family continue to strive to get on with the business and to improve their environment.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, fresh shrimp, fresh shellfish, etc.

loans.name: Lizeth Estefania

texts.es: Lizeth, tiene 31 años de edad,  está casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlantida. Lizeth, decidió poner su propio negocio para generar ingresos para su familia y estableció una pulpería hace 3 años que lo tiene donde ofrece diferentes tipos de productos alimenticios como ser carnes, granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, refrescos, churros, pan, azúcar, manteca y otros. El prestamo que solicito es por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual es el segundo ciclo con ODEF y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos alimenticios para la venta como ser arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, carnes, lácteos, embutidos etc. y asi poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, obteniendo mejores ganancias. Su plan es sacar adelante a la familia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 31 years old, she is married, has two children and lives in the town of La Masica, Atlantida. Lizeth decided to establish her own business in order to earn the income for her family and opened a grocery store. She has had this store for 3 years and sells various types of food, for example meat, bulk grains, dairy, cold cuts, soft drinks, donuts, bread, sugar, lard, and more. 

The loan she requested is for 15,000 lempiras. It is her second cycle with ODEF and she will use to loan to buy more food products for her store, like rice, beans, sugar, lard, soft drinks, meat, dairy, cold cuts, etc. By this she will be able to offer a greater variety of products and to make more profit. 

It is her plan to get her family ahead and she wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, beans, sugar, lard, soft drinks, meat, dairy, cold cuts, etc. to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential region for beekeeping. 

William is married, and has seven children. He has been farming for forty-one years, and is currently tending to a maize crop and rearing livestock. William likes keeping bees, because it is not a taxing activity. The bees generally take care of themselves. 

This is William’s first loan, and he plans to use the profits from his hives “for general family upkeep.” His hope for the future is “to have a stable family in all scopes of life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives on a farm close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Susan is married and has two children. Both she and her husband have been farming for six years, and are currently growing maize, bananas and beans as well as tending to livestock. Susan likes beekeeping because “It doesn't require constant supervision.”

This is Susan’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the profits generated by her beehives to educate her young children. Her hope for the future is “to see my children getting the best education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Rose is widowed, and has nine children. She is currently keeping chickens, goats and cows on her land, and has been doing so for five years. Rose likes beekeeping because it is an income-producing project, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to help her take care of her cows, by buying them feed and medicine. 

This is Rose’s first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to save up enough money to “build a big house for my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Samuel is married, and has four children. Both he and his wife work as farmers, and they are currently growing an assortment of crops on their land as well as tending to a tree plantation. He was interested in becoming involved with beekeeping because it will be a chance to train the younger generation about this valuable skillset. 

This is Samuel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start horticulture farming on his land. In the future, he hopes to start a demo farm, with livestock, grain crops, trees and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed lives near Kikoneni, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Mohamed, who runs a small business in town, is married to a teacher and has two children. A farmer for 15 years, he is currently growing mangoes on his land. He is interested in starting beekeeping because it will be a good source of income for his family, and his bees will also help pollinate his crops, leading to higher production.

This will be Mohamed’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to increase the stock in his business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu lives on a farm in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Mariamu is married, and has five children. Both her and her husband are farmers and have been farming for twenty-five years. They are currently tending to an orange orchard, which will be an excellent source of nectar for their bee colonies. Mariamu is excited to become a beekeeper because it will give her family a source of natural honey to eat. 

This is Mariamu's first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mariamu hopes to save up enough money to build a new family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es una mujer casada de 50 años y tiene 5 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de adobe junto a su esposo. Se dedica al campo y producción de cacao, barbasco y otros productos de su zona hace más de 30 años con el apoyo de su esposo. Cuando se inició no contaba con un terreno propio para su labor independiente, es por ello que se inició como trabajadora en otros terrenos y posteriormente con el dinero que reunió conjuntamente con su esposo  y apoyo de sus padres adquirió un terreno de 2 hectáreas que se convertiría en el principal sustento de su economía. Actualmente posee una buena variedad de plantaciones con cacao de buena calidad comercial que son muy solicitados en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Uno de sus principales objetivos es reunir dinero y mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda en beneficio de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para seguir invirtiendo en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico y herramientas para cultivar.
texts.en:
Irene is a married, fifty-year-old woman.  She has five children, all of whom live with her and her husband in their home made from adobe.  She makes a living in farming and in producing cocoa, barbasco, and other local products.  She has been doing this for more than thirty years with the support of her husband.  When she began this work, she did not have her own land.  Therefore, she began as a worker on other lands and later, with the money she earned together with her husband and with support from her parents, she acquired a plot of land (roughly two hectares).  

This land now provides her with a way to make her own money.  She currently has a good variety of cocoa crops that are of a high commercial quality and that are frequently requested in the store centers in her town.  One of her principle objectives is to save up money in order to improve the infrastructure of her home, an activity that will benefit her entire family.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to continue moving forward.  She promises to pay her installments on time.  At this time, she is requesting 1,000 soles; she will continue to invest in her lands by buying organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.name: Epimaque

texts.en: Epimaque is 42 years old. He is a father of five children aged between 10 and 17. He sells utensils and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more saucepans and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 38 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She operates a charcoal making business made of coconut shells, which she has been doing for two years.

Nora is requesting a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional coconut shells. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has two children and works hard to support her family. She operates a tailoring business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling food. 

Teresita is requesting her ninth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional cloth, needles, and thread  for her tailoring business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, needle,and  thread

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old, married to Winnie, and together they are blessed with three children who are in school.

He has a transport business in Naivasha which he has been running for ten years. His average monthly income is KSH 100,000. Peter has applied for his fourth loan from Kadet Ltd after paying his previous loans successfully to enable him to service his car. With the anticipated the profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to service the car.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 years. She works seven days a week.   She gets additional income from selling cooking oil. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Sarah aspires to sell wholesale, build rental rooms, and educate her children up to university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mamadou Cellou

texts.fr:
Mamadou Cellou, âgé de 41 ans, habite un village situé a quelques kilomètres de la ville principale. Il s’active dans la fabrication de moulin à mil. Il a acquis une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. 
Mamadou Cellou n’a jamais  bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC, il vient pour la première fois solliciter un prêt de 150000F CFA pour acheter un moteur et réparer un moulin a mil comme il en fabrique. 
Mamadou Cellou reçoit beaucoup de commande de moulin car il est pratiquement le seul à en faire dans la zone. Il arrive à nourrir sa famille avec les recettes de son activité et pense travailler avec IMCEC afin d’ouvrir une grande unité de fabrication de ses engins et devenir un grand fournisseur.
texts.en:
Mamadou Cellou, who is 41 years old, lives in a village which lies several kilometers away from the capital. He is active in making millet mills and has gained ten years' experience in this field. He has never had a loan from IMCEC and has for the first time requested a loan of 150,000FCFA to buy an engine for repairing millet mills as he manufactures them.

Mamadou Cellou gets a lot of orders for mills since he is practically the only person to make them in this area. He manages to feed his family with the income he makes from his business, and is thinking of working with IMCEC so that he can open a large manufacturing unit for his machines and become a significant supplier.

loans.use: to buy an engine for repairing millet mills and for manufacturing them for sale.

loans.name: Cielo Group

texts.en:
Rosa and her family live in the western highlands of Guatemala in a rural community called Llanos del Pinal. She is a 51-year-old married woman with five children who range in age from 13 to 29. The population in her area have small farms where they raise various crops as well as animals. Many of the women are seamstresses.

Rosa is a member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cielo” meaning “Heaven”. She shares a dream of a better life with 13 other women in the group. The ladies work in textile production, and most of them also grow flowers and other agricultural products as well as raising animals.

As Rosa and her family have been farmers for several years, she decided it would be advantageous for her to increase the amount of land she cultivates. She joined the Cielo Trust Bank and secured her first loan. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and is eager to receive her latest loan request of $512. She will use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizer for the onions, lettuce, carrots and broccoli that are produced on the farm. These vegetables are then sold to wholesalers in a large market located about one hour away. 

When the women involved in Friendship Bridge are asked about the future, they respond by saying they realize that education is the key to a better and more successful future. Rosa realizes how important it is in order for her children to live a more successful life. She knows they will learn to speak Spanish as well as her native dialect. Four of her children are currently in school, with two in high school on the weekends. In this way, the older children can work on the farm during the week.

Rosa and the other women of the Trust Bank Cielo are grateful for the support and trust of Kiva investors throughout the world. With a small loan and education, these hardworking ladies can sustain or grow their businesses, realize an increase in their earnings, empower themselves and eliminate poverty for their families and community.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lodinela

texts.en:
Lodinela is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Lodinela operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Lodinela is requesting her eleventh loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase soft drinks, beer, shampoo, soap, canned goods, rice, feeds, etc. She hopes to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, shampoo, soap, canned goods, rice, feeds, etc.

loans.name: Songre Group

texts.fr:
NIENKOUN est responsable du groupe SONGRE. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 05ans et va à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend du savon et de l’eau glacée depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 01sac de savon kabakourou et 02cartons de savons parfumé.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Nienkoun is in charge of the Songre group. She is married and mother to one child, who is five years old and goes to school. She has two dependants. She has been selling soap and iced water for the past five years, and she gets her supplies from the market in Toecin. Her customers are men and women. 

Nienkoun would like to buy one sack of "Kabakourou" soap and two cartons of perfumed soap. She wants to save her profits, and her ambition is to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one sack of "Kabakourou" soap and two cartons of perfumed soaps.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Merlina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from entertainment (videoke). Merlina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia works hard to support her family. Amelia is married and has a buy and sell jewelry business in the Philippines. Amelia requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry stock to sell. Amelia has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Amelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry stock to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is 61 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Celsa is borrowing a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed. Celsa has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from working in a general store. She works tirelessly toward her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Justine Huénamon

texts.fr: Justine Huénamon âgée de 60 ans, est veuve avec deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Justine Huénamon vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Justine Huénamon. Justine Huénamon n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Justine Huénamon vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce et de poissons) à son domicile depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire,Justine Huénamon vend des assiettes. Justine Huénamon s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but diversifier son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Justine Huénamon sollicite pour la cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Justine Huénamon is a 60-year old widow with two children in her care, one of whom goes to school. She lives with her children and covers all the household expenses herself. She did not go to school and so, in order to provide for her family's needs, she has for the past ten years been selling food (rice with sauce and fish) from her home. She sells plates as a secondary activity. 

Justine Huénamon gets her supplies in a Benin market. With a view to diversifying her business and responding better to customer demand, she is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil and plates.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 33 years of age. He is single and plans to have a wife in the near future.  He has been a maize farmer for the last three years. He will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming he wants to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing for her buy and sell used clothing business. Maria has been in this business for 10 years. Maria earns more income from food vending. Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, aged 56, finished only the primary level of education because of her family’s financial limitations. She then dropped out of school and decided to help her parents with their farm work. She still continues doing this work. She started having her own family in her twenties and has given birth to four children, all of whom are now married adults. She appeared in the photo with her granddaughter.

Pao has decided to request another loan to invest in buying a half-hectare of land to enlarge her farming area. She has seen positive results from her previous loans with HKL. She believes that this loan will enable her to have a better harvest and generate a higher income. She hopes to change their living conditions as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to buy a half-hectare of land to enlarge her farming area.

loans.name: Tulga

texts.en: Mr. Tulga is a Bachelor's degree student who studies in public university. This loan will support him to pay tuition fees. He is a very hardworking student. His father has his own private studio, thus in order to support and carry on his business he chose his major as a electrical engineer as well as he is quite interested in this area.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Akovognon Dieudonné

texts.fr: Akovognon Dieudonné âgé de 25 ans, est marié à une ménagère du nom de Aline. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Akovognon Dieudonné et sa femme. Akovognon Dieudonné a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Akovognon Dieudonné achète des noix de palme qu'il transforme en huile de palme, et revend par la technique de distribution depuis sept ans. Akovognon Dieudonné s'approvisionne dans son village. Dans le but diversifier son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Akovognon Dieudonné sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Akovognon Dieudonné is 25 years old and married to a housewife called Aline. The couple has four children, who are all at school and not dependants. Akovognon Dieudonné and his wife cover all the household expenses between them. He attended school up until secondary level. In order to provide for his family's needs, he has for the past seven years been buying palm nuts, which he makes up into palm oil and sells through the distribution system.

Akovognon Dieudonné gets his supplies in his village. With a view to diversifying his activity and responding better to customer demand, he is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé. The previous loans were all repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Reverina

texts.en:
Reverina is 49 years old. She is married with four children aged between seven and nineteen. She has been running the business of farming for the past six years. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 57 years old and married. She has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maxima runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to purchase stock for her store, including shampoo, soap, spices, sugar, and canned goods.

In the future Maxima would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store, including soap, spices, and canned goods

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from 'buy and sell' vegetables. Elena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell for her business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 47 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. The operator of a food production business in the Philippines for 21 years, she has received three previous loans from NWTF and is requesting a new one for  PHP 10000 to buy more ingredients for her enterprise.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo, a dairy farmer, is heavily involved in helping his neighbors live more harmoniously with their environment. He leads by example and his farm is representative of his mission. He tries to avoid the use of agrochemical fertilizers and prefers the abundant manure produced by his cows to fertilize his crops. He is investing in a 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he sees it as another tool to further his goal of reducing his negative impact on the environment. The biodigester will process the manure into methane-rich biogas, allowing him to displace the fossil-fuel based LP gas he currently uses to cook and heat bathwater.

This displacement coupled with the destruction of methane released by the animal waste will dramatically reduce the amount of greenhouse gases emitted by his farm. Concurrently, the biofertilizer will allow even more nutrients to reach his plants' roots than currently available from unprocessed manure due to the natural decomposition that occurs within the digester. Ricardo wants to show his neighbors that it is possible to better utilize what they normally consider waste. He wants them to see that everything should be valued as a resource, if used properly. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to pay for a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and a biogas stove

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor is  54 years old and married. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She sells building materials to local people by renting a stall in an outdoor market, which she has been doing for 15 years. Before becoming a retailer, she worked in kindergarten, educating children. Her husband is a self-employed photographer. 

Dolgor is requesting a loan for 2,400,000 MNT, which she will use to buy building materials in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Kondiougou 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme   Awa Hamidou debout en cinquième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 22.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 5 are married women who, on average, are 40 years old, have 4 children, and live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the end of the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution. 

They are primarily growing onions with Madame Awa Hamidou who is standing 5th from the right in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy seeds and fertilizer. They sell their crops after the harvest in the villages of Ondougou and Bandiagara to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She would like to earn a profit of 22,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season. She will use these profits to help her husband with the family expenses: food, schooling for their children, and health. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjromede 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HADJROMEDE 1 est composé de vingt quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Pascaline (celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Pascaline est mariée à un maçon du nom de Dossou. Le couple a quatre enfants, aucun de ces enfants n’est scolarisé et eux tous sont à leur charge. Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que depuis dix ans, Pascaline vend divers produits (riz, sucre, huile) à son domicile. Pascaline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’accroitre le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Pascaline ensemble avec les autres membres du HADJROMEDE 1 sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Hodjromede group is made up of people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Pascaline (and is the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 36 years old and did not go to school. With the goal of raising their business level in order to better meet the demands of her clientele, the group is asking for the first time for the financial support of ALIDé. Pascaline is married to a mason by the name of Dossou. The couple has four children, none of which are in school and all of whom are in their care. Pascaline lives together with her husband and their children. Together, the couple takes care of the needs of the household. It is for this reason that for ten years, Pascaline has sold various products (rice, sugar, oil) from her home. Pascaline stocks up in the market of Benin. In order to grow the level of her business and meet the needs of her clientele, Pascaline together with the other members of Hodjromede is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase various products (rice, sugar, oil).

loans.name: Banakane 9 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BANAKANE 9 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Oumou Hamadou debout en première  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de  23.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en: The members of Banakane 9 Group are all married women with an average age of 44 and 5 children.  They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, the 5th largest administrative region in Mali.  They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a micro-finance organization, in order to conduct their gardening business at the end of winter.  They are on their first loan with the organization. The main crop is essentially onions, grown by Ms. Oumou Hamadou, standing at the far left in the photo.  WIth her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village level, in Bandiagara and Mopti, to male and female customers.  She plans to earn a profit of 23,000 FCFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to help her husband pay for family expenses and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne âgée de 44 ans, est mariée à un certain Nicephore. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par Jeanne et son mari. Jeanne a très peu fréquenté l'école. Dans le but d'assister son mari dans les différentes charges de la maison, Jeanne vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) depuis dix ans de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend également des tissus. Jeanne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but diversifier son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite pour la cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
