Jeanne, age 44, is married to a man named Nicephore. They have four dependent children who all go to school. Jeanne lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Jeanne received minimal schooling. To assist her husband with household expenses, Jeanne has been selling food (rice and sauce dish) as an itinerant vendor for the past ten years. She also sells fabrics. She buys her stock at a market of Benin. 

To diversify her activity and better meet customer demand, Jeanne is seeking a 5th loan from ALIDé. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments and fabrics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and married with three children; one child is in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Srieng

texts.en:
Srieng is a 33-year-old, married woman. She lives with her spouse and two school-aged children in a small village of Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. She is actively involved in agricultural activities to help her husband take care of their rice crop and also works as a market vendor, selling vegetables and fish.

Srieng decided to have this loan in order to buy fertilizers to keep her rice crop in good condition. She hopes to have an abundant harvest, which she sells to local retailers at a good price. The loan granted via HKL will enable her to go ahead with her current business and make it become a viable source of income. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to keep her rice crop in good condition.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a 'buy and sell' rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for six years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 34 years old. She is a mother of six children. She has been selling cooking oil and sodas for the past five years. With the loan, Vestine would like to buy more crates of sodas and cooking oil for sale. She plans to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of sodas and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members, a man and a woman, and responsible for their families. They are come from Teshie which is located in the coastal zone of the country. These people are characterized by being hard working, responsible, and wanting to excel. Unfortunately due to lack of enough economic resources they were not able to study and were obligated to work from a young age in order to help with the household expenses. 
Robert sells rubber bottle drinks for six years. He does this work 8 hours daily on foot. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of four carton of bottle drinks so that in the no too distant future he can obtain better income. He is married and has two children. ID-Ghana is appreciated to the support of the Kiva investors that provide to this people. 
They will need a total amount of GHS 1700 to buy enough and sell to mobile enough profit.

loans.use: To purchase four cartons of bottle drinks for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and widowed with six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, sugar, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, etc., to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy aditional items like rice, sugar, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Urantsetseg

texts.en: Ms.Urantsetseg is very passionate student who studies in private university to be an international journalist and translator. This is her final year, thus this loan is really important for her and her family. If she did not get this loan, she would be obliged to take off for one year. She has chose her major based on her interests.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Sèvèho Rémi

texts.fr: Sèvèho Rémi âgé de 37 ans, est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Sèvèho Rémi vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Sèvèho Rémi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire, mais a appris la couture par la suite. C'est une activité qu'il exerce dans son atelier depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Sèvèho Rémi, est assisté dans les charges de ménage par sa femme. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sèvèho Rémi désire acquérir un nouvelle machine à surfiler. C'est pour cette raison que Sèvèho Rémi sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sèvèho Rémi, age 37, is married to a merchant named Beatrice. They have two dependent children, one of whom goes to school. Sèvèho Rémi lives with his wife and their children. He received secondary level schooling, then went on to learn to sew. He has been practicing this activity for 15 years out of his own shop, which has allowed him to support his family without difficulty. His wife assists him in handling household responsibilities. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Sèvèho Rémi wishes to purchase a new serging machine. To that end, he is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a serging machine.

loans.name: Sounday Sèvèho

texts.fr: Sounday Sèvèho âgé de 38 ans, est marié à une marchande du nom de Mélanie. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sounday Sèvèho n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Sounday Sèvèho exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans à son domicile. Sounday Sèvèho vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées par Sounday Sèvèho et sa femme. Parallèlement à son activité, Sounday Sèvèho vend des bois de chauffage ce qui lui permet de répondre sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sounday Sèvèho sollicite pour la cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Sounday Sèvèho, who is 38 years old, is married to Mélanie, a merchant. The couple has four children, all dependants and some of whom go to school. Sounday Sèvèho did not attend school but learned how to sew and has been doing this as a job for the past five years from home. He lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife cover all the household expenses. In parallel with his main activity, Sounday Sèvèho also sells firewood, and this enables him to provide for his family's needs without any difficulty. With a view to strengthening his business and better responding to customer demand, he is requesting a fifth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and firewood.

loans.name: Uran

texts.en:
Uran is a bachelor degree student who studies at a public university. She has chosen her major as a beverage technologist. 

This loan will help her to pay for a laptop. Throughout the semester, it is quite difficult to do her assignments without a laptop computer. She is very hard-working student

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Linda has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more food to sell like chicken, pork, hotdogs, etc.  Linda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell like chicken, pork, hotdogs, etc

loans.name: Tegou 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TEGOU 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Fatouma assise en deuxième  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de la ville de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 44000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Tegou 1 group are all married women who are, on average, 35 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Fatouma grows onions, and she is the person seated second from the left. With her loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and town of Bandiagara, to men and women customers. 

Fatouma hopes to earn 44,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, health and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Tegou 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TEGOU 4 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Aîssa
debout  en première  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Tegou 4 group are all married women who are, on average, 36 years old and have six children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution.

Aissa grows onions, and she is the person standing first on the left of the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level and in Bandiagara, to men and women customers. 

Aissa hopes to earn 24,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Djidia Ii (Courrage) Group

texts.fr:
Djidia II est un regroupement de femmes de Baramba qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées  avec au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels la vente de riz, de la restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Ester  est un membre du groupe Djidia II, première debout de la gauche vers la droite.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de riz des cartons de macaroni. Elle se procure de ces aliments  à Baramba. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires bien cuits au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djidia II comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Ester compte réaliser  67 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Djidia II is a group of women from Baramba who live in traditional larger families. They have an average age of 37 years, are married, and each have at least 5 children. This group of women is in the business of various articles such as the sale of rice, catering, etc. In order to increase their business, the members decided to partner with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Ester is a member of the Djidia II group, pictured standing from left to right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase a bag of rice and boxes of macaroni. She obtains these foods in Baramba. She sells her platters of cooked food for cash out of her home and at the market to a varied customer base. 

While the other members of the Djidia II group hope to earn an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA each during their loan cycle, Ester hopes to earn 67,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of their profits to take care of personal expenses and to increase their business funds.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for catering

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr:
Monsieur Thierno, âgé de 72 ans s'active toujours dans le commerce malgré son âge. Il est père d’une grande famille car il est polygame ; ce qui explique qu'il travaille toujours de 9h du matin a 18h de l'après-midi. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce domaine qui consiste à vendre des tissus. Il a une cantine dans le marché ce qui est moins fatiguant pour lui, puisse qu’il ne se déplace pas. 
Thierno s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne, appuyé par son grand fils qui a commencé à travailler. 
Son souhait le plus cher serai d’assurer  à sa descendance une vie correcte et de les mettre a l’abri du besoin.  C'est dans ce sens qu'il travaille toujours pour pouvoir assurer la dépense et leur permettre de s'affirmer et de réaliser quelque chose dans leur vie.Il leur prodigue de bons conseils et leur donne même des fois de la marchandise a vendre qui puisse générer des bénéfices et régler leurs  besoins sans dépendre d’autrui.
texts.en:
Mr. Thierno is 72 years old and still active despite his age. He is the father of a large family as it is polygamous, which is why he works from 9am to 6pm everyday. He has done business for over 20 years selling fabric. He has a little store in the market, which is less tiring since it does not move.

Thierno handles the daily expenses, supported by his son, who is starting to take care of things little by little. His dearest wish is to ensure that his descendants have a decent life and freedom from want. That's why he ensures that each child could have a proper business that can generate income and take of their needs without depending on others.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients  like meat, seasonings, chicken and  bamboo sticks

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: Affi est une femme veuve âgée de 65ans avec 4enfants dont l’ainé a 38ans et le dernier 28ans. Elle est ménagère et vend aussi du maïs, du charbon et de mèches à toutes personnes. Par insuffisance de capital, elle sollicite son premier auprès de WAGES pour l’achat et la vente de mais, de charbon et de mèches.  Elle espère avoir une boutique et commander plusieurs marchandises puis nourrir la famille. Elle exerce depuis 2000.
texts.en: Affi is a 65-year-old widow with four children, of whom the oldest is 38, and the youngest is 28. She works as a domestic and also sells corn, charcoal, and hair extensions to all comers. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES for buying and selling corn, charcoal, and hair extensions. She hopes to have a store, order several more goods, and then provide food for her family. She has been in business since 2000.

loans.use: to purchase corn, charcoal, and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Julibeth is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julibeth is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Julibeth has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting  a new loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya works hard to support her family. Jumdaya is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jumdaya requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, etc.

Jumdaya has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jumdaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, sugar, etc

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, a 34-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Having borrowed and repaid ten previous loans from NWTF, Analyn has requested a new one for PHP 25000 in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dental services business in the Philippines. Matilde has been in this business for 20 years now.

Matilde requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment like chairs, tables, a dental kit, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment like chairs, tables, a dental kit, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuella Group

texts.fr:
M.ISABELLE  est responsable du groupe EMMANUELLA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mme est gérante de kiosque depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne les grandes boutiques de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes et hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 01carton de spaghetti, 01bidon d’huile et 01sac de riz pour préparer et revendre.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Ambitionne agrandir son kiosque et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabelle is the leader of the Emmanuella group. She is married with four children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest six months old. Three of them go to school.
Mrs. Isabelle has been a stall holder for three years. She buys her stock at the bigger shops in her neighbourhood. Her customers are men and women.
Mrs. Isabelle would like to buy one box of spaghetti, one can of oil and one sack of rice for the preparation of her goods.
She wants to save the profits. She hopes to expand her stall and pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of spaghetti, 1 can of oil and 1 sack of rice for preparation and resale.

loans.name: Tharith

texts.en:
Tharith is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage. He has two dependent children who are attending local primary school. He works as a paid laborer in a garment factory, earning a normal salary, which goes for meals, other costs, and allowances for his children. His wife also works with him in the same workplace to financially support this family.

Tharith is seeking other ways of generating enough income to provide for their basic needs. As an initiative, he would like to start up a clothes selling business, but he has insufficient capital to realize his plans. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 1,500 US dollars from Kiva and the field partner to buy used clothes for sale. He dreams of improving his family’s quality of life and moving ahead with his plans to be successful. He promised to himself that he will send his children to attend university class after their graduation.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Siguimame Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  SIGUIMAME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution.
Mme MINATA (1ère à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt des céréales puis les revendre à Zantoumala et en famille. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguimame group are married women of an average age of 36 years with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the sub prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to manage their businesses. This is their eighth loan from the institution.
Mrs. Minata (who is first on the right in the photo), plans to buy cereals with her loan to sell in Zantoumala and within her family.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10.000FCFA.
The profit will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a person who wants the best for her family and, at the age of 38, she is striving hard to earn more income for her children's education. 

She has been in a retail business for almost seven years, earning a net income of PHP 400 daily.  Due to a lack of capital, Josephine has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase pork meat, fish, and chicken meat to sell. 

She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase pork meat, fish, and chicken meat to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents. She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling pre-paid mobile phone load.

Daisy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy an additional stock of used clothing to sell.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Lydia requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients, like chicken, cooking oil, and spices.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like chicken, cooking oil, and spices

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 53 years old and married with seven children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

Nilda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Remy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Remy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional crabs to sell for her buy and sell crabs business.

Remy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jane has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Jane would like to build and expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to stock and sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Janeth is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and for maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and for maintenance

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en:
Saadat is 53 years old, married, and is raising four children with her husband. She has a high school degree, and she works as a nurse at the village hospital. The main source of income for the family is their livestock. She started the livestock business 20 years ago. Because of her and husband's hard work and perseverance, the family now owns 20 sheep and one cow. 

In order to repair the roof of the stall and their house, Saadat has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN.

loans.use: To repair the roof of the stall.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a farmer from Norashen village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two small daughters (six and three years old), and her mother-in-law. Elena's husband works in the private sector. To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Elena is engaged in cultivation of tomato, alfalfa, and several fruits (apricot, cherry, pomegranate, grapes and walnut). Horticulture is an important source of income for the family. They realize the agricultural products in the local market. They have two special refrigerators for fruits, where they can keep fruits fresh for a long time. Elena currently needs a loan of USD 3,000 to buy grapes and keep them in the fruit refrigerators to sell them during the winter. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy grapes to keep and sell during the winter

loans.name: Qiromiddin

texts.ru: Киромидин доброжелательный и отзывчивый мужчина в возрасте 31 года. Он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на приобретение скот. Сам Киромидин с малых лет занимается  животноводством, помогая поначалу своему отцу в этом деле. А сейчас когда он сам имеет свою семью и троих детей, он стабильно ведёт данный бизнес и получает от этого хороший доход. Расходов в его семье очень много, так как детей нужно кормить, одевать и обувать. Поэтому Киромидин хочет расширять свой бизнес. Ему необходимо закупить больше голов скота для дальнейшего вскармливания и продажи. Его жена также помогает ему продавать молоко, полученное от данного скота, что приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Сейчас Киромидин обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Qiromiddin is a kind and understanding man. He is 31 years old. He turned to Arvand to request a loan to buy cattle. From a young age, Qiromiddin has practiced animal husbandry, starting out by helping his father in this trade. And now that he has his own family and three children, he manages his own business consistently and receives good earnings from it. His family has a lot of expenses, as he needs to feed, clothe and educate his children. This is why Qiromiddin wants to expand his business. He needs to buy more cattle to fatten them up and sell them in the future. His wife also helps him to sell milk from their cows, which bring in additional earnings for the family. Now Qiromiddin is turning to Arvand to request a loan to buy cattle. He thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and a married woman. She has eight children. She owns and operates a business venture, 'elei.' ('Elei' is an art form, painted designs on fabrics.) She has two years of experience in this line of business.

Anita needs a loan, which she will use to buy materials, including fabrics, fabric paint, stencils, paint rollers and an 'elei' carved board. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy materials for making painted fabrics, including fabric paint, stencils, and an 'elei' carved board

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is 23-year-old married woman with three children. 

She owns and operates a business venture,elei fabric printing. She has two years of experience in this line of business.

Menime needs a loan to buy materials, stencils, brushes, cutter, fabric color paints and elei carved board for her business. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, stencils, brushes, cutter, fabric color paints and elei carved board.

loans.name: Perive

texts.en:
Perive is a 31-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Perive has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, knives,a spade and a wheelbarrow her plantation.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Perive hopes to save for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Badamgarav

texts.en: Mrs. Badamgarav, 48 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling materials used for making dresses such as thread, cotton and needles to local people since 2001. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their son has a disability and stays at home. Their daughter studies in Korea to further her education. She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to pay her daughter's tuition fee. She thinks the best thing she can do for her daughter is to invest in her education.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 59 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y su hijo, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Pedro no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Pedro trabaja como estibador en una empresa portuaria de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea construir la fachada de su hogar con materiales adecuados y resistentes, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura que brinde mayor seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 59 year old man. He lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and child.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he puts all his efforts into getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a very young age, Pedro couldn’t study for a professional degree.  Through his own initiative, Pedro works as a dockworker for a harbor company in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours and believes that things go smoothly for him because of his dedication and efforts.

Pedro is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have given he will improve his home. He wants to construct the front of his building with suitable, hard-wearing materials, so he will keep working and putting forth effort to achieve his dream of having a safe home that provides greater security for his family.

loans.use: to improve his home with the use of suitable and hardwearing materials.

loans.name: Allem

texts.en:
Allem is 40 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. Allem has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, and cream.

In the future Allem would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, canned goods, and eggs

loans.name: Ermitancia

texts.en:
Ermitancia is 50 years old and married, with nine children.

Ermitancia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

Ermitancia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell tobacco business for six years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ermitancia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has an ice candy business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional refrigerator for the storage of her ice candy.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional refrigerator for the storage of her ice candy.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 47 years old and married. She has two children who are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Edna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Chuluunchimeg

texts.en: Chuluunchimeg is a student pursuing her bachelor's degree at a private college. This loan will help her to pay her tuition fee. There is no alternative option to pay for tuition. If she did not get a loan, she would have to take off a year from the college.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a 53-year-old, married woman, with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killers, water, a wheel barrow, spades, and shovels.

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. With her profits, Pelenatete hopes to improve her business, to help family matters and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killers, water, a wheel barrow, spades, and shovels.

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina is 62 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns income from farming coconuts. 

Myrlina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, charcoal shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. Myrlina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, charcoal shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ailyn has a restaurant in the Philippines and she has been in this business for eight years.

Ailyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juricita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Juricita works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Juricita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

Juricita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old and is married with three children. Two of her children are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for her children. 

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc. Lorna has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine works hard to support her family. Valentine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Valentine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional chicken, beef, pork, etc. to sell. Valentine has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Valentine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additonal chicken, beef, pork, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 58 years old and is married with ten children.  

Lydia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. Lydia has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos de 26 y 28 años de edad, por iniciativa propia hace 10 años fundó su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, a la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en atenderlo, su trabajo inicia a las 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 3:00 p.m.; el préstamo lo invertirá en compra de mamanas, peras, zanahoria, aguacates, lechugas, etc., para tener lo necesario en su negocio,  así brindarles productos variados y frescos a sus clientes.
Le ayudara a ampliar más su negocio, responderá a las demanda de sus clientes, y a generar los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su situación económica, también de ellos podrá pagar las cuotas del  crédito.
Su sueño es tener los recursos necesarios para poder comprar su casa propia y darle  a su familia un patrimonio.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who lives with her two children, 26 and 28 years old. Through her own initiative, 10 years ago she established her business selling fruits and vegetables. Until today she has not had any problems tending to it. Her work begins at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 3:00 p.m. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of mamons, pears, carrots, avocados, lettuce, etc., to have what is necessary for her business and so be able to provide a variety of fresh products to her customers.

It will allow her to increase her business more, respond to her customers’ demand, and to generate the income necessary to improve her economic situation and to be able to make payments on her loan.

Her dream is to have the resources necessary to be able to buy her own home and give an inheritance to her family.

loans.use: to purchase mamons, pears, carrots, avocados, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena is a 50-year-old woman who is married and has six children. She runs a small plantation and grows crops to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Matalena has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a chain saw. She plans to use her profits to help her family and also for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a chain saw.

loans.name: Nazanzaya

texts.en:
Nasanzaya is a bachelor degree student who studies in the public university in financial management. 

She has chosen her major based on her interest and she sees that when she graduates her university, she can get job easily. 

This loan will help her to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Choidogjamts

texts.en: Choidogjamts, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. Choidogjamts has been smelting iron at a steel factory since 2004. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy fiberglass, cotton and foam in order to insulate his house. After insulation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to insulate his house.

loans.name: Assogba

texts.fr: Assogba âgé de 39 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Léa. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Assogba n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Assogba exerce cette activité depuis douze ans. Assogba vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. De façon secondaire, Assogba vend des produits de cheveux et des matériels de coiffure dans son atelier. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Assogba sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Assogba, age 39, is married to a merchant named Lea. They have three children who all go to school. Assogba did not receive any schooling, but he did learn hairstyling, an activity he has been practicing for 12 years. Assogba lives with his wife and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

As a secondary activity, Assogba sells hair and styling products out of his salon. 

To strengthen his activity and better meet customer demand, Assogba is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair and styling products.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a married woman and a mother of seven children from San Miguel, Bohol. 

She is engaged in food-vending business selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Bebiana is asking for a loan to buy more food stocks like banana, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place. Bebiana hopes to make her food vending a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more food stocks like bananas, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 67 years old and widowed.  She has twelve children. Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years now,

Gloria requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising livestock. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc. for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beer, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old. She is married with five children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rebecca aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married, with three children. With one child currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, snack foods, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, snack foods, and other groceries. 

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nida is 43 years old and her three children are in school.

Nida has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell, like spices, milk, soap, shampoo, and eggs.

Nida has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell, like spices, milk, soap, shampoo, and eggs.

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 43 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Emy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. Emy has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Emy would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now. Rose works hard to support her family. 

Rose requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery goods to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, spices, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 45 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. 

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Carmelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Rosemarie has been in this business for two years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old. She is married with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, coffee, milk, diapers, snack foods, cooking oil, etc. to sell. Editha has been in this business for 7 years. 

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, coffee, milk, diapers, snack foods, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 44 years old and has five children in school.

Elsie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc. Elsie has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, rice, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, reconoce que con los créditos tiene mejores ingresos es por eso que nuevamente está solicitando un crédito, que será el complemento para comprar una vaca parida e insumos para alimentarla. El capital anterior fue bien invertido le ayudo a seguir trabajando y evito deshacerse del ganado que ya tenía.
 Para él es satisfactorio saber que hoy su familia ya tiene mejores condiciones de vida, están saludables.
texts.en:
Mateo recognizes that with the help of the loans he has a better income, and it is because of this that he is newly requesting a loan that will help him to purchase a calved cow and supplies to feed her. The previous capital was well-invested. It helped him to continue working and avoid dissolving the farm that he had.

For him it is satisfactory knowing that today his family already has better living conditions and are healthy.

loans.use: to purchase a calved cow and supplies to feed her.

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Ane has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bushknives, fertilizer, a water storage container, a wheelbarrow and a pickaxe.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Ane hopes to improve her business and use her business profit for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, fertilizer, a water storage container, a wheelbarrow and a pickaxe

loans.name: Katherine Marcela

texts.es: La joven Katherine Marcela habita en Managua, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y se ha dedicado por completo a sus estudios universitarios, actualmente esta culminado su carrera de Licenciatura en Diseño y Comunicación y su mayor sueño es trabajar en diseño editorial, además de ampliar sus conocimientos en diseño a través de una maestría fuera del país. Ella es una persona apasionada a los libros y la lectura  porque es algo que impacta su vida, cultura y educación. Katherine solicita su crédito para la culminación de sus estudios, los cuales están enfocados en los gastos de graduación.
texts.en: Katherine Marcela is a young woman living in Managua. She is 21 years old and single.  She has been working to complete her university studies, currently finishing her undergraduate degree in Design and Communication.  Her dream is to work in editorial design, further adding to her knowledge of design by studying abroad for a Master’s Degree.  She is passionate about books and reading because it is something that impacts her life, culture, and education.  Katherine is seeking a loan for the finalization of her studies, focusing on graduation expenses.

loans.use: to finish her studies, focusing on graduation expenses.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria has had a general store business for almost five years. She earns a net income of PHP 300 daily.  However, due to a lack of capital, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 23,000 to purchase beverages, food, spices, bread, coffee, sugar, and noodles to resell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, food, spices, bread, coffee, sugar, and noodles to resell in her store

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
"Having a husband abroad doesn’t mean you are financially stable," Clarita says. She is 39 years old, married, and has one child attending school. 

With her determination to help her husband in meeting their needs, Clarita engages herself in a retailing business. She is selling drinks, bread, spices, eggs, and noodles in her sari-sari store. Clarita wants to extend the items she sells and be able to increase her income, as well. 

Clarita wants to borrow a loan, amounting to PHP 20,000, to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, and conditioner to sell. She hopes that her business will grow, so that, someday, her sari-sari store becomes a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, shampoo, and conditioner to sell.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao, 41, lives with her common-law husband and has an adult child. Together they have been working as farmers for more than 20 years on their own farm, which they inherited from their parents after their marriage. They currently live and raise their child in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, where they learned everything related to agriculture, especially growing rice and raising poultry. Through their hardships, they are able to earn enough income to maintain their household.

Sreymao, as a hard-working mother who is always dedicated to daily household chores and who pays close attention to taking care of her family members, has requested a loan to build a latrine and buy its accessories.  This will help protect them from disease and keep the environment clean by releasing fewer pollutants. Sreymao is very happy and thankful because HKL has provided her a special interest rate on this loan due to its intended purpose. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. Analyn grows rice in her farm.

Analyn is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Analyn has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita earns a living through her hog raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Carmencita has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Carmencita is asking for a loan to buy animal feeds and supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her profit and income.

Carmencita hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and supplements for the pigs.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 62 years old and married, the mother of four grown children. Dioscora lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is engaged in the food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judith has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Judith would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Rutchel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like cream, spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. She has been in this business for two years.

Rutchel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like cream, spices, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Susan has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverage products to restock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. She also hopes that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new beverage products.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to sell, to satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to sell.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. 

Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam would like to take a further loan to buy materials and tools for baking bread to sell.  Nam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for baking bread to  sell

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is requesting a new loan to buy beauty products, such as hair care products and face care products. 

Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, such as hair care products and face care products.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment, and materials

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
María de 45 años, vive junto a su esposo de 65 años de edad. Procrearon 2 hijas, que tienen  24 y 20 años de edad respectivamente y un hijo que es técnico electricista. De estos, solo este último vive con ellos, las hijas se han casado.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace más de 20 años,  esta labor la hace con el apoyo de una hermana. Esta actividad la hace desde que el esposo, quedó desempleado. El maíz  y la leña lo compra a comerciantes de la zona, se la llevan hasta el local de trabajo. Este local es el garaje de su vivienda.

El préstamo servirá  para realizar el pago del préstamo vigente en Fundación CAMPO y pagar  a un amigo que le prestó, para solventar un problema de salud del esposo y el resto lo utilizará en la compra de maíz y leña. 

De esta manera, fortalecerá con capital de trabajo y permitir que la familia no tenga un desbalance financiero, por las cuentas por pagar.

Al capitalizarse, podrá comprar el maíz en temporada de cosechas y es donde se encuentra a menor precio, de compra en el mercado y al pagar las deudas, se quedará con una responsabilidad financiera, permitiendo que puedan honrar satisfactoriamente.

Piensa, seguir con el  negocio y apoyar a sus hijos, para que puedan tener sus viviendas.
texts.en:
María, age 45, lives together with her 65 year old husband. They have two daughters, ages 24 and 20 respectively, and a son who is an electrical technician.  Of these, only the last one lives with them; the daughters have gotten married.

For more than twenty years, she has worked making and selling tortillas. She does this work with the support of a sister.  She has been doing this work since her husband became unemployed.  She buys the corn and the firewood from vendors in the area and carries them to her place of business, which is in the garage of her home.

The loan will serve to make the payment on a current loan from Fundación CAMPO and to repay a friend who had lent to her to take care of a health problem for her husband.  She will use the rest to buy corn and firewood.

In this way, she will reinforce her working capital and allow her family to avoid a financial imbalance due to their debts.

After this financing, she will be able to buy corn in the harvest season when it can be found at a lower price in the markets, and will pay her debts. She will still have a financial responsibility, allowing her to be able to honor her debts satisfactorily. 

She plans to continue with her business and support her children so that they can buy their own homes.

loans.use: to complete the payment of an active loan with Fundación CAMPO and to repay a friend who had loaned her money to straighten out a health problem for her husband. The rest she will use to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio’s greatest dream in life is having investment in his village and financing his children's education. Rogelio is engaged in a service business repairing malfunctioned televisions and he also has a hog raising business. He now has his business stall in his village, but before this he provided his services in different villages by going house to house. 

Rogelio wants to expand his business by putting up a piggery business as an additional source of income. He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy piglets to raise, as well as to buy other materials needed in his electronics repair business. He hopes that his businesses will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, as well as to buy other materials needed in his electronics repair business

loans.name: Loko Paul

texts.fr: Loko Paul âgé de 58 ans, est marié à une marchande nommée Mahoussi. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Loko Paul n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la menuiserie ; activité qu'il exerce depuis seize ans à son domicile. Loko Paul vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les charges de la maison son supportées par le couple. Pour assumer pleinement ses responsabilités, Loko Paul vend de façon parallèle des bois de chauffage. Loko Paul s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Loko Paul sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Loko Paul, aged 58, is married to a merchant named Mahoussi. The couple have six children, some of whom are enrolled in school and all of whom are still their parents' responsibility. 

Loko Paul was not able to attend school, but he learned carpentry, a business activity that he has been in for 16 years, working out of his home. He lives with his wife and children. The household expenses are covered by the couple. 

In order to fully assume his responsibilities, Loko Paul also sells firewood. He stocks up on firewood in his region. Wishing to grow that activity, he is requesting his sixth loan from ALIDé. His prior loans were correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Ana Cynthia

texts.en:
Ana Cynthia is 52 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 28 years.

Ana Cynthia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock such as canned goods, beer, eggs, nuts, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beer, eggs, nuts, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children, and he has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are from his farm: milk, eggs, tea.  He is seeking a loan to buy more poultry.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Cultivating." His biggest challenge is "limited capital." 

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Low interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to develop a saving culture."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family?" Peter replied "Better farm yields."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following:  a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido nuevamente a trabajar con crédito para comprar maíz, harina, crema, y otros para la venta de tortillas y quesadilla. Ha incrementado el número de clientes satisfechos, su negocio es más amplio, sus ingresos son mejores lo que le permiten cumplir con sus compromisos económicos. 
Por todo lo bueno antes mencionado les puede brindar  a sus hijos una  mejor alimentación, educación y mejores condiciones de vida en general.
texts.en:
Maria has once again decided to work with a loan to purchase corn, flour, cream, and other ingredients for making and selling tortillas and quesadillas. The numbers of Maria's satisfied customers have increased, her business is more ample, and her income is improved, all of which allows Maria to comply with her economic commitments.

Due to all of these positive factors, Maria is able to offer her children an improved diet, education, and better conditions of life in general.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, cream, and other ingredients for making tortillas and quesadillas to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients for making cakes. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. 

Huong hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar, 49 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling meat to local people by renting a stall at a market since 2003. This is the only source of income for his family, so he decided to rent one more stall to sell diary products. 

For this reason, Tsogtbayar is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay the rent and buy diary products at wholesale prices in large amounts for resale. As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his family. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to rent a stall and sell diary products

loans.name: Olinda Hilge

texts.es:
Olinda es una mujer de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Olinda pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Olinda trabaja como asistente administrativa en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Olinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea ponerle piso de concreto a la habitación de su hijo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Olinda is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her young child. She is a hardworking single mother who dedicates all of her efforts towards getting ahead. Thanks to her efforts, Olinda was able to study a Business Administration technical degree.

On her own initiative, Olinda works as an administrative assistant at a business in her city. She works every day for about ten hours, and thinks that it is going very well thanks to her dedication and hard work. 

Olinda is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since she will be able to improve her home thanks to this loan. She would like to install a concrete floor in her son's room. She will continue to work and push herself in order to achieve her dream of finishing the construction of her whole home.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Mary runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling firewood. Mary aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Charlotte est un leader  du de l’association d’affaire « Mashauri », entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique.  La cliente  est une vendeuse de friperie au marché public. Il y a 17 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle commença cette activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son époux.  Grace à ce commerce, elle a réalisé plusieurs projets en faveur de ses enfants et pour sa famille. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 1 ballon de friperie. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants obtenir leurs  diplômes universitaires et accroître son activité. Au finish, elle salue l’initiative de Hekima pour son soutien et autonomisation des femmes non bancables surtout dans le contexte actuel de la guerre à l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo où l’économie n’est pas stable.
texts.en:
Featured borrower Charlotte is a leader of the business group called « Mashauri », an entrepreneur, 50 years of age and the mother of six children who are all in school. Her husband is a civil servant in Public Administration. She herself sells used clothing in the public market. She has been in this business for 17 years. She started up the business with her own money that she received from her husband. 

Thanks to this business, she has managed to do a good deal for her children and for her family. This new loan will allow her to buy one bale of used clothing. She would like to see her children get university diplomas and also to grow her business. Finally, she would like to salute Hekima for its initiative supporting women who don't have access to financial services and helping them become self-sufficient, especially in the present context of the war in the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where the economy is not stable.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “JULIO C. TELLO AL PROGRESO” está  conformada por 08 socias quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minoristas. Floriana tiene 58 años es conviviente con hijos independientes. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta hace 20 años se dedica a la venta comida, golosinas, gaseosas y frutas en un quiosco en las afueras de su vivienda. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de menú en un mercado. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres, golosinas y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Floriana es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste chompa blanca.
texts.en:
The “Julio C. Tello Al Progreso” Group is composed of 8 members who are dedicated to diverse commercial retail activities. 

Floriana, president of the group, is 58 years old, married, and her children are now independent. For the last 20 years, she has sold food, candy, soft drinks, and fruit in a kiosk outside her house. Years ago, she used to sell meals in a public market. Floriana will invest her loan in purchasing groceries, candy, and soft drinks. Floriana is the 2nd person seated from the left of the picture and is wearing a white sweater.

The Group is grateful to Kiva investors for the offer of a loan.

loans.use: buy groceries, candy, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
